quote: In my opinion we are at the limit now, and 17 races is really too much. With all the testing that we do now, it means we're always on the bike and it's quite difficult.
author: Valentino Rossi

quote: Also, when I started racing he knew a lot of people and it was more easy for me to find the first bike, so I have a good chance for sure.
author: Valentino Rossi

quote: I race to win. If I am on the bike or in a car it will always be the same.
author: Valentino Rossi

quote: We have the 2004 M1 here for reference, which is useful. It worked well here last year; we won the race and always did fast lap times so it will be interesting to compare it to the new bike and it will help us to understand which parts have improved.
author: Valentino Rossi

quote: Fortunately during my career I have won more or less everything, so I need to enjoy it to have the right motivation.
author: Valentino Rossi

quote: In 2002 the Yamaha was at more or less the same level as the Honda, better in some ways, worse in others. But in the winter of last year between 2002 and 2003, Honda made a big step forward and it seemed as if Yamaha couldn't quite match that improvement.
author: Valentino Rossi

quote: I was lucky. My father raced bikes. He gave me the passion very early. I had my first bike when I was three or four years old.
author: Valentino Rossi

quote: If I test the car for a year I can be quite competitive the next season.
author: Valentino Rossi

quote: To win the Championship in the first year will be hard. We need time to become competitive and win races.
author: Valentino Rossi

quote: The work that we do during the winter is very important; we have a new bike and it's important to develop it during this time, and we start with this test.
author: Valentino Rossi

quote: How do Ferrari know what I'm doing next year when I don't know what I'm doing next week?
author: Valentino Rossi

quote: I have won on Honda and Yamaha so maybe it is interesting to win with a third team, Ducati, who are Italian.
author: Valentino Rossi

quote: My father raced bikes. He gave me the passion very early. I had my first bike when I was three or four years old.
author: Valentino Rossi

quote: But I could also start F1 or rallying. I love rallying much more.
author: Valentino Rossi

quote: You look at Moto3, the races are very exciting. Moto2 is fantastic, and then MotoGP is boring.
author: Valentino Rossi

quote: Maybe if Graziano make another work or another sport I wouldn't have had this passion to be a rider.
author: Valentino Rossi

quote: As for the level of spectacle of the two disciplines, I leave it to the people who watch the races to comment.
author: Valentino Rossi

quote: If you live to be a hundred, I want to live to be a hundred minus one day so I never have to live without you.
author: A. A. Milne

quote: Weeds are flowers too, once you get to know them.
author: A. A. Milne

quote: Organizing is what you do before you do something, so that when you do it, it is not all mixed up.
author: A. A. Milne

quote: It is more fun to talk with someone who doesn't use long, difficult words but rather short, easy words, like 'What about lunch?'
author: A. A. Milne

quote: Did you ever stop to think, and forget to start again?
author: A. A. Milne

quote: One of the advantages of being disorderly is that one is constantly making exciting discoveries.
author: A. A. Milne

quote: The third-rate mind is only happy when it is thinking with the majority. The second-rate mind is only happy when it is thinking with the minority. The first-rate mind is only happy when it is thinking.
author: A. A. Milne

quote: You can't stay in your corner of the forest waiting for others to come to you. You have to go to them sometimes.
author: A. A. Milne

quote: Some people care too much. I think it's called love.
author: A. A. Milne

quote: Don't underestimate the value of doing nothing, of just going along, listening to all the thing you can't hear, and not bothering.
author: A. A. Milne

quote: To the uneducated, an A is just three sticks.
author: A. A. Milne

quote: Never forget me, because if I thought you would, I'd never leave.
author: A. A. Milne

quote: What I say is that, if a fellow really likes potatoes, he must be a pretty decent sort of fellow.
author: A. A. Milne

quote: I suppose that every one of us hopes secretly for immortality; to leave, I mean, a name behind him which will live forever in this world, whatever he may be doing, himself, in the next.
author: A. A. Milne

quote: Golf is so popular simply because it is the best game in the world at which to be bad.
author: A. A. Milne

quote: If one is to be called a liar, one may as well make an effort to deserve the name.
author: A. A. Milne

quote: Bores can be divided into two classes; those who have their own particular subject, and those who do not need a subject.
author: A. A. Milne

quote: My spelling is Wobbly. It's good spelling but it Wobbles, and the letters get in the wrong places.
author: A. A. Milne

quote: The Old Testament is responsible for more atheism, agnosticism, disbelief - call it what you will - than any book ever written. It has emptied more churches than all the counter-attractions of cinema, motor-bicycle and golf course.
author: A. A. Milne

quote: A writer wants something more than money for his work: he wants permanence.
author: A. A. Milne

quote: You will be better advised to watch what we do instead of what we say.
author: A. A. Milne

quote: I gave up writing children's books. I wanted to escape from them as I had once wanted to escape from 'Punch': as I have always wanted to escape. In vain.
author: A. A. Milne

quote: Almost anyone can be an author; the business is to collect money and fame from this state of being.
author: A. A. Milne

quote: Tiggers don't like honey.
author: A. A. Milne

quote: War is something of man's own fostering, and if all mankind renounces it, then it is no longer there.
author: A. A. Milne

quote: A clever conjurer is welcome anywhere, and those of us whose powers of entertainment are limited to the setting of booby-traps or the arranging of apple-pie beds must view with envy the much greater tribute of laughter and applause which is the lot of the prestidigitator with some natural gift for legerdemain.
author: A. A. Milne

quote: I am sure of this: that no one can write a book which children will like unless he write it for himself first.
author: A. A. Milne

quote: Is 'The Wind in the Willows' a children's book? Is 'Alice in Wonderland?' Is 'Treasure Island?' These are masterpieces which we read with pleasure as children, but with how much more pleasure when we are grown-up.
author: A. A. Milne

quote: No sensible author wants anything but praise.
author: A. A. Milne

quote: As I enter a new phase of life and my circle broadens, I start learning new things.
author: Kapil Dev

quote: If you play good cricket, a lot of bad things get hidden.
author: Kapil Dev

quote: Irrespective of any political party, I am a supporter of good people who want to do something for the society.
author: Kapil Dev

quote: The next generation has always been and will be better than the previous one. If it is not, then the world would not be moving forward.
author: Kapil Dev

quote: When you have to work, work with a smile.
author: Kapil Dev

quote: The hunger to win must not die... The appetite has to remain big.
author: Kapil Dev

quote: I always breathe cricket.
author: Kapil Dev

quote: I don't look into negative things. Go past mistakes and look forward.
author: Kapil Dev

quote: Sports should not become routine. It should be about passion.
author: Kapil Dev

quote: All you have to do is to dream big and try to fulfil it.
author: Kapil Dev

quote: I think pride is more important sometimes than making money.
author: Kapil Dev

quote: Selectors can't please everyone, but I am OK if they are working for the benefit of Indian cricket. It's an administrative decision to appoint a selection committee, and I would like to let them do their job.
author: Kapil Dev

quote: Good sports facilities are a blessing.
author: Kapil Dev

quote: If your work becomes a source of enjoyment and a challenge, it will never seem like work - it will be fun. If you ever feel that your work is a burden, there is no point carrying on with it.
author: Kapil Dev

quote: Cricket is very simple... you play till you can sustain.
author: Kapil Dev

quote: In the long run, I believe that honesty is definitely the best policy. One can get away by being dishonest for a short term, but ultimately, honesty is what pays.
author: Kapil Dev

quote: Apart from education, you need good health, and for that, you need to play sports.
author: Kapil Dev

quote: I was a naughty kid. Teachers did not like me much.
author: Kapil Dev

quote: Every person gets negative things, they learn from those negative things, and you become a positive person.
author: Kapil Dev

quote: When you are growing up, everyone will help you. When you reach the top, everyone will start pulling you down. The same people who help you will be the same people who try to pull you down.
author: Kapil Dev

quote: Test cricket is a different sort of cricket altogether. Some players who are good for one-day cricket may be a handicap in a Test match.
author: Kapil Dev

quote: No cricket should be played for at least a month anywhere in the world after a World Cup.
author: Kapil Dev

quote: People often ask me whether I believe in God. I haven't seen God. But I think that one's beliefs are one's God - and, in those terms, yes, God is there.
author: Kapil Dev

quote: Spirituality lies in what you do and how you do it and not what result you get.
author: Kapil Dev

quote: It is always nice when you are honoured. The Lifetime award makes me feel old. I am only 55.
author: Kapil Dev

quote: I, as a cricketer, would like to see 100 counties playing top-flight cricket, just like tennis and football. If I am alive to see that, I will be very happy.
author: Kapil Dev

quote: Certain cricketers are meant to play Test cricket.
author: Kapil Dev

quote: People never expected a boy from a small town to have a life like I did.
author: Kapil Dev

quote: My best wishes are with Indian cricket in general. I wish each one of our cricketers success at the international and domestic level.
author: Kapil Dev

quote: Try and understand: cricket was played by Commonwealth countries only; now it has started in other countries as well, and I am proud of that.
author: Kapil Dev

quote: Speed can't always get you wickets.
author: Kapil Dev

quote: Sports is my passion.
author: Kapil Dev

quote: I never wanted to take autographs, always wanted to give them. To do this, you have to achieve something.
author: Kapil Dev

quote: When I was a boy, cricket was very, very English. Anyone who spoke English and anyone from a big town could play. And that was it.
author: Kapil Dev

quote: I feel that World Cup cricket should be played like football in which all the 160 countries take part. If only a handful of countries are going to keep on playing in the World Cup without making the game popular, I will be a sad man.
author: Kapil Dev

quote: Though teenagers are generally very interested in sports, they must realise that education is the most important thing in their lives. They must find the right balance.
author: Kapil Dev

quote: Virat Kohli has so far shown that he has more ability and talent than anybody else, and if he can play till 32 or 34 with same fitness and without injuries, he will come to a point where not even Vivian Richards neither Sachin Tendulkar had such a record.
author: Kapil Dev

quote: The West Indians and Pakistanis play one-day cricket so well because they play for English counties.
author: Kapil Dev

quote: I never said, 'I wouldn't help a cricketer if he approaches me.'
author: Kapil Dev

quote: There is inspiration all around us.
author: Kapil Dev

quote: Let me clarify it through the national news agency that I am not joining Aam Aadmi Party. There has been reports that I will be officially joining AAP, but I can assure you that nothing of that sort is happening.
author: Kapil Dev

quote: I used to hate any batsman who would not get out in my deliveries.
author: Kapil Dev

quote: The biggest test for any cricketer in England is the weather.
author: Kapil Dev

quote: It isn't easy being a celebrity cricketer in India.
author: Kapil Dev

quote: I have great respect for Jaypee Greens as a company that has produced a truly world class, 24-carat, championship golf course. I am happy to be associated with a company with such outstanding qualities.
author: Kapil Dev

quote: I have no political aspirations. That's it.
author: Kapil Dev

quote: Fast bowling is an art, like spin bowling.
author: Kapil Dev

quote: If I can teach cricket overseas, why wouldn't I do so in my own country?
author: Kapil Dev

quote: Maybe a day will come when we may have to just put on a pair of glasses and see sports events.
author: Kapil Dev

quote: My role models have kept on changing.
author: Kapil Dev

quote: I wasn't a ladies' man.
author: Kapil Dev

quote: If you have two good off spinners, what is the problem in playing both of them.
author: Kapil Dev

quote: All artists are crazy.
author: Kapil Dev

quote: Cricket has become more popular, not me... When the game grows, those who've played it also 'grow.'
author: Kapil Dev

quote: If you are playing on a turning wicket, toss plays an important role. The team that wins the toss gets an opportunity to play on the fresh wicket. You should always prepare the wicket as per team's strength. But a rank turner might backfire.
author: Kapil Dev

quote: When you take risks and things don't go your way, you can be heavily criticised by the media.
author: Kapil Dev

quote: I am not too intelligent.
author: Kapil Dev

quote: I have played cricket on my own terms.
author: Kapil Dev

quote: As a sportsman, my aim was to help sportspersons grow. The idea is to see what is good for sport rather than what's good for individuals.
author: Kapil Dev

quote: As an Indian, I would like to back my government.
author: Kapil Dev

quote: There is pleasure in the pathless woods, there is rapture in the lonely shore, there is society where none intrudes, by the deep sea, and music in its roar; I love not Man the less, but Nature more.
author: Lord Byron

quote: Be thou the rainbow in the storms of life. The evening beam that smiles the clouds away, and tints tomorrow with prophetic ray.
author: Lord Byron

quote: Absence - that common cure of love.
author: Lord Byron

quote: Love will find a way through paths where wolves fear to prey.
author: Lord Byron

quote: Man's love is of man's life a part; it is a woman's whole existence. In her first passion, a woman loves her lover, in all the others all she loves is love.
author: Lord Byron

quote: Sorrow is knowledge, those that know the most must mourn the deepest, the tree of knowledge is not the tree of life.
author: Lord Byron

quote: Always laugh when you can. It is cheap medicine.
author: Lord Byron

quote: The great art of life is sensation, to feel that we exist, even in pain.
author: Lord Byron

quote: All who joy would win must share it. Happiness was born a Twin.
author: Lord Byron

quote: There are four questions of value in life, Don Octavio. What is sacred? Of what is the spirit made? What is worth living for and what is worth dying for? The answer to each is the same. Only love.
author: Lord Byron

quote: I only go out to get me a fresh appetite for being alone.
author: Lord Byron

quote: Then stirs the feeling infinite, so felt In solitude, where we are least alone.
author: Lord Byron

quote: But words are things, and a small drop of ink, Falling like dew, upon a thought, produces That which makes thousands, perhaps millions, think.
author: Lord Byron

quote: Now hatred is by far the longest pleasure; men love in haste but they detest at leisure.
author: Lord Byron

quote: I love not man the less, but Nature more.
author: Lord Byron

quote: The best prophet of the future is the past.
author: Lord Byron

quote: Man, being reasonable, must get drunk; the best of life is but intoxication.
author: Lord Byron

quote: Those who will not reason, are bigots, those who cannot, are fools, and those who dare not, are slaves.
author: Lord Byron

quote: Yes, love indeed is light from heaven; A spark of that immortal fire with angels shared, by Allah given to lift from earth our low desire.
author: Lord Byron

quote: Friendship may, and often does, grow into love, but love never subsides into friendship.
author: Lord Byron

quote: Death, so called, is a thing which makes men weep, And yet a third of life is passed in sleep.
author: Lord Byron

quote: Fools are my theme, let satire be my song.
author: Lord Byron

quote: Adversity is the first path to truth.
author: Lord Byron

quote: Friendship is Love without his wings!
author: Lord Byron

quote: We are all selfish and I no more trust myself than others with a good motive.
author: Lord Byron

quote: There is no instinct like that of the heart.
author: Lord Byron

quote: For truth is always strange; stranger than fiction.
author: Lord Byron

quote: Fame is the thirst of youth.
author: Lord Byron

quote: Between two worlds life hovers like a star, twixt night and morn, upon the horizon's verge.
author: Lord Byron

quote: Men love in haste, but they detest at leisure.
author: Lord Byron

quote: If I don't write to empty my mind, I go mad.
author: Lord Byron

quote: The heart will break, but broken live on.
author: Lord Byron

quote: Ye stars! which are the poetry of heaven!
author: Lord Byron

quote: But what is Hope? Nothing but the paint on the face of Existence; the least touch of truth rubs it off, and then we see what a hollow-cheeked harlot we have got hold of.
author: Lord Byron

quote: Truth is always strange, stranger than fiction.
author: Lord Byron

quote: Roll on, deep and dark blue ocean, roll. Ten thousand fleets sweep over thee in vain. Man marks the earth with ruin, but his control stops with the shore.
author: Lord Byron

quote: Society is now one polished horde, formed of two mighty tries, the Bores and Bored.
author: Lord Byron

quote: For pleasures past I do not grieve, nor perils gathering near; My greatest grief is that I leave nothing that claims a tear.
author: Lord Byron

quote: Though I love my country, I do not love my countrymen.
author: Lord Byron

quote: The 'good old times' - all times when old are good.
author: Lord Byron

quote: There is something pagan in me that I cannot shake off. In short, I deny nothing, but doubt everything.
author: Lord Byron

quote: Prolonged endurance tames the bold.
author: Lord Byron

quote: Why I came here, I know not; where I shall go it is useless to inquire - in the midst of myriads of the living and the dead worlds, stars, systems, infinity, why should I be anxious about an atom?
author: Lord Byron

quote: Life's enchanted cup sparkles near the brim.
author: Lord Byron

quote: Like the measles, love is most dangerous when it comes late in life.
author: Lord Byron

quote: All farewells should be sudden, when forever.
author: Lord Byron

quote: I am sure of nothing so little as my own intentions.
author: Lord Byron

quote: The dew of compassion is a tear.
author: Lord Byron

quote: I know that two and two make four - and should be glad to prove it too if I could - though I must say if by any sort of process I could convert 2 and 2 into five it would give me much greater pleasure.
author: Lord Byron

quote: This man is freed from servile bands, Of hope to rise, or fear to fall; Lord of himself, though not of lands, And leaving nothing, yet hath all.
author: Lord Byron

quote: A woman should never be seen eating or drinking, unless it be lobster salad and Champagne, the only true feminine and becoming viands.
author: Lord Byron

quote: This is the patent age of new inventions for killing bodies, and for saving souls. All propagated with the best intentions.
author: Lord Byron

quote: There is no such thing as a life of passion any more than a continuous earthquake, or an eternal fever. Besides, who would ever shave themselves in such a state?
author: Lord Byron

quote: Who loves, raves.
author: Lord Byron

quote: Her great merit is finding out mine - there is nothing so amiable as discernment.
author: Lord Byron

quote: Shakespeare's name, you may depend on it, stands absurdly too high and will go down.
author: Lord Byron

quote: The busy have no time for tears.
author: Lord Byron

quote: A mistress never is nor can be a friend. While you agree, you are lovers; and when it is over, anything but friends.
author: Lord Byron

quote: Cervantes smiled Spain's chivalry away; A single laugh demolished the right arm Of his country.
author: Lord Byron

quote: There's naught, no doubt, so much the spirit calms as rum and true religion.
author: Lord Byron

quote: I love you the more in that I believe you had liked me for my own sake and for nothing else.
author: John Keats

quote: A thing of beauty is a joy forever: its loveliness increases; it will never pass into nothingness.
author: John Keats

quote: Heard melodies are sweet, but those unheard are sweeter.
author: John Keats

quote: 'Beauty is truth, truth beauty,' - that is all ye know on earth, and all ye need to know.
author: John Keats

quote: Nothing ever becomes real till it is experienced.
author: John Keats

quote: The poetry of the earth is never dead.
author: John Keats

quote: I am certain of nothing but the holiness of the heart's affections, and the truth of imagination.
author: John Keats

quote: The excellency of every art is its intensity, capable of making all disagreeable evaporate.
author: John Keats

quote: Love is my religion - I could die for it.
author: John Keats

quote: My imagination is a monastery and I am its monk.
author: John Keats

quote: Now a soft kiss - Aye, by that kiss, I vow an endless bliss.
author: John Keats

quote: Scenery is fine - but human nature is finer.
author: John Keats

quote: What the imagination seizes as beauty must be truth.
author: John Keats

quote: Poetry should surprise by a fine excess and not by singularity, it should strike the reader as a wording of his own highest thoughts, and appear almost a remembrance.
author: John Keats

quote: There is nothing stable in the world; uproar's your only music.
author: John Keats

quote: Do you not see how necessary a world of pains and troubles is to school an intelligence and make it a soul?
author: John Keats

quote: Philosophy will clip an angel's wings.
author: John Keats

quote: The only means of strengthening one's intellect is to make up one's mind about nothing, to let the mind be a thoroughfare for all thoughts.
author: John Keats

quote: Here lies one whose name was writ in water.
author: John Keats

quote: You are always new, the last of your kisses was ever the sweetest.
author: John Keats

quote: Much have I traveled in the realms of gold, and many goodly states and kingdoms seen.
author: John Keats

quote: I would sooner fail than not be among the greatest.
author: John Keats

quote: There is an electric fire in human nature tending to purify - so that among these human creatures there is continually some birth of new heroism. The pity is that we must wonder at it, as we should at finding a pearl in rubbish.
author: John Keats

quote: Poetry should... should strike the reader as a wording of his own highest thoughts, and appear almost a remembrance.
author: John Keats

quote: With a great poet the sense of Beauty overcomes every other consideration, or rather obliterates all consideration.
author: John Keats

quote: Poetry should be great and unobtrusive, a thing which enters into one's soul, and does not startle it or amaze it with itself, but with its subject.
author: John Keats

quote: I will give you a definition of a proud man: he is a man who has neither vanity nor wisdom one filled with hatreds cannot be vain, neither can he be wise.
author: John Keats

quote: He ne'er is crowned with immortality Who fears to follow where airy voices lead.
author: John Keats

quote: Though a quarrel in the streets is a thing to be hated, the energies displayed in it are fine; the commonest man shows a grace in his quarrel.
author: John Keats

quote: It appears to me that almost any man may like the spider spin from his own inwards his own airy citadel.
author: John Keats

quote: I have been astonished that men could die martyrs for religion - I have shuddered at it. I shudder no more - I could be martyred for my religion - Love is my religion - I could die for that.
author: John Keats

quote: There is not a fiercer hell than the failure in a great object.
author: John Keats

quote: I am in that temper that if I were under water I would scarcely kick to come to the top.
author: John Keats

quote: Land and sea, weakness and decline are great separators, but death is the great divorcer for ever.
author: John Keats

quote: You speak of Lord Byron and me; there is this great difference between us. He describes what he sees I describe what I imagine. Mine is the hardest task.
author: John Keats

quote: Praise or blame has but a momentary effect on the man whose love of beauty in the abstract makes him a severe critic on his own works.
author: John Keats

quote: The Public - a thing I cannot help looking upon as an enemy, and which I cannot address without feelings of hostility.
author: John Keats

quote: I have two luxuries to brood over in my walks, your loveliness and the hour of my death. O that I could have possession of them both in the same minute.
author: John Keats

quote: I feel you can be down and out but if you are determined, nothing can stop you from winning.
author: Siddharth Shukla

quote: To be honest, I am very comfortable with myself.
author: Siddharth Shukla

quote: I am the last person on Earth who can be diplomatic. I say what I actually feel.
author: Siddharth Shukla

quote: I want my future wife or girlfriend to be herself.
author: Siddharth Shukla

quote: Reality shows make you more bold and you learn new skills like dancing, anchoring.
author: Siddharth Shukla

quote: I am a morning person and the first task for me in the morning is to hit the gym.
author: Siddharth Shukla

quote: India's Got Talent' is one of the biggest platforms for talent across the world.
author: Siddharth Shukla

quote: I don't have any issue with people seeing my real self.
author: Siddharth Shukla

quote: I mean there's something I have achieved in life, even if it's little, and if people write about it, then it's fine.
author: Siddharth Shukla

quote: I love to dance, but the flip side is that I can't dance.
author: Siddharth Shukla

quote: What I look for in a girl is honesty.
author: Siddharth Shukla

quote: I don't think it makes sense to set high goals about how my ideal woman should be. It is like calling for trouble. That would make one close-minded and not open to meeting different kinds of people.
author: Siddharth Shukla

quote: TV is one of the biggest mediums, and over time, it will get bigger.
author: Siddharth Shukla

quote: My work will speak for me. In fact, I never had a PR and I still don't.
author: Siddharth Shukla

quote: I am really grateful to 'Balika Vadhu' for the recognition I have got because of it. People know me and like me because of it.
author: Siddharth Shukla

quote: I have been a pampered boy, the youngest in the family with two elder sisters. I have always had someone around me, usually my mom, to take care of everything for me.
author: Siddharth Shukla

quote: I have a confession to make - I am very fond of junk food.
author: Siddharth Shukla

quote: It's important that we treat our bodies with respect because it's what we have to make do with as long as we live.
author: Siddharth Shukla

quote: In 'BV,' every actor's performance touches your heart. The team on the show is dedicated, which inspires me a lot.
author: Siddharth Shukla

quote: I feel blessed to be working with a banner like Dharma Productions.
author: Siddharth Shukla

quote: After my debut film, I was doing reality shows and hosting so it was not that I had nothing else to do.
author: Siddharth Shukla

quote: The food in Mathura is authentic and delicious. Mathura is famous for its Chana Chidwa which was my cheat snack for the two days I spent there.
author: Siddharth Shukla

quote: I don't think the audience for film or TV is different. I think they are the same people who go out on weekends.
author: Siddharth Shukla

quote: I come from a school of thoughts where I actually don't plan anything.
author: Siddharth Shukla

quote: My only problem, and this has been a constant worry on television, is time management. The deadlines on television are killing.
author: Siddharth Shukla

quote: There was a time when I really wanted to do films, but they didn't come my way. I would come close and the next day suddenly I'd realise that I am not a part of the film anymore. So that's how television happened.
author: Siddharth Shukla

quote: I don't have a type. I am more of a sapiosexual person. The girl has to be intelligent.
author: Siddharth Shukla

quote: I don't have any fears.
author: Siddharth Shukla

quote: Since I have already connected with fans on TV, I don't fear losing out on my movie fans, even if I am away from the silver screen for a long time.
author: Siddharth Shukla

quote: I have been tagged mischievous since childhood and was known as a prankster.
author: Siddharth Shukla

quote: I have never decided on how to plan my career moves.
author: Siddharth Shukla

quote: I was a very protected and confused kid till 24. It was after then, that I started taking my life seriously.
author: Siddharth Shukla

quote: As a model, only a limited number of people knew about me.
author: Siddharth Shukla

quote: I sleep early and I don't party.
author: Siddharth Shukla

quote: Television is growing. It is a huge market for great content.
author: Siddharth Shukla

quote: Web series are a way forward. It is a space where creative minds can express themselves without the fear of censor board.
author: Siddharth Shukla

quote: I was a child who was interested in sports, and represented my school in football, cricket, badminton and table tennis.
author: Siddharth Shukla

quote: I am not a dancer and for me, to learn the art is fun. It gives you the confidence that you can dance.
author: Siddharth Shukla

quote: I don't mind falling in love with an actress. I don't have any reservations.
author: Siddharth Shukla

quote: hooting for 'Savdhaan India' in Mathura made me realise that no matter what place you come from be it a holy city, crime still prevails.
author: Siddharth Shukla

quote: Jhalak Dikhhla Jaa 6' was the turning point in my career.
author: Siddharth Shukla

quote: Amitabh Bachchan's role in 'Deewar'... I'd love to do that if someone does a remake.
author: Siddharth Shukla

quote: As for me I may not have relatives in the film industry. But I grew up in Mumbai as an avid moviegoer. So I don't feel like an outsider.
author: Siddharth Shukla

quote: Films are something that happened by chance.
author: Siddharth Shukla

quote: Balika Vadhu' is the best thing to have happened to me.
author: Siddharth Shukla

quote: Televison is time bound. Whereas a movie has time. You can't write a script for television and keep it for one year.
author: Siddharth Shukla

quote: I wake up at 5:30 and head to the gym and reach the sets by 8:30. So there is nothing to write about me. But people have to say something, so they make up some gossip. It's okay I guess.
author: Siddharth Shukla

quote: Acting is acting at the end of the day. How does it matter if it is in films or on TV?
author: Siddharth Shukla

quote: I am not one of those actors who will abandon my flagship serial, my main claim to fame, just because I've done a hit movie.
author: Siddharth Shukla

quote: But the whole viewership of 'Balika Vadhu' is more than all shows of mine put together. The show has a lot of reach and that has worked for me.
author: Siddharth Shukla

quote: Link-ups go hand-in-hand with TV shows. You do a show and you get linked with your co-star.
author: Siddharth Shukla

quote: I enjoy coming to Ahmedabad. The city is really awesome and people here are warm and hospitable.
author: Siddharth Shukla

quote: Humpty' was something I had to do. I had to stretch myself as an actor.
author: Siddharth Shukla

quote: When not shooting, I love to catch up on my sleep.
author: Siddharth Shukla

quote: My lunch is the staple Indian meal - rotis, vegetables and dal. But instead of wheat rotis, I have rotis made of bran or barley.
author: Siddharth Shukla

quote: This entire journey from 'Balika' to 'Jhalak' to 'Humpty' has been a dream.
author: Siddharth Shukla

quote: Of course, I'd love to do Bollywood.
author: Siddharth Shukla

quote: I can't take up every film that is being offered to me.
author: Siddharth Shukla

quote: Trying times will begin when I will take up my second film as that's when people will take me more seriously. I will have to prove myself too.
author: Siddharth Shukla

quote: I am only looking forward to good film script. It doesn't matter if the role is a supporting or a standalone role.
author: Siddharth Shukla

quote: Victory has a thousand fathers, but defeat is an orphan.
author: John F. Kennedy

quote: Change is the law of life. And those who look only to the past or present are certain to miss the future.
author: John F. Kennedy

quote: As we express our gratitude, we must never forget that the highest appreciation is not to utter words, but to live by them.
author: John F. Kennedy

quote: A nation that is afraid to let its people judge the truth and falsehood in an open market is a nation that is afraid of its people.
author: John F. Kennedy

quote: Physical fitness is not only one of the most important keys to a healthy body, it is the basis of dynamic and creative intellectual activity.
author: John F. Kennedy

quote: My fellow Americans, ask not what your country can do for you, ask what you can do for your country.
author: John F. Kennedy

quote: Let us never negotiate out of fear. But let us never fear to negotiate.
author: John F. Kennedy

quote: Let us not seek the Republican answer or the Democratic answer, but the right answer. Let us not seek to fix the blame for the past. Let us accept our own responsibility for the future.
author: John F. Kennedy

quote: The ignorance of one voter in a democracy impairs the security of all.
author: John F. Kennedy

quote: There are risks and costs to action. But they are far less than the long range risks of comfortable inaction.
author: John F. Kennedy

quote: Forgive your enemies, but never forget their names.
author: John F. Kennedy

quote: Those who make peaceful revolution impossible will make violent revolution inevitable.
author: John F. Kennedy

quote: The pay is good and I can walk to work.
author: John F. Kennedy

quote: Things do not happen. Things are made to happen.
author: John F. Kennedy

quote: Conformity is the jailer of freedom and the enemy of growth.
author: John F. Kennedy

quote: Let every nation know, whether it wishes us well or ill, that we shall pay any price, bear any burden, meet any hardship, support any friend, oppose any foe to assure the survival and the success of liberty.
author: John F. Kennedy

quote: Efforts and courage are not enough without purpose and direction.
author: John F. Kennedy

quote: When written in Chinese, the word 'crisis' is composed of two characters. One represents danger and the other represents opportunity.
author: John F. Kennedy

quote: A man may die, nations may rise and fall, but an idea lives on.
author: John F. Kennedy

quote: Leadership and learning are indispensable to each other.
author: John F. Kennedy

quote: Too often we... enjoy the comfort of opinion without the discomfort of thought.
author: John F. Kennedy

quote: The cost of freedom is always high, but Americans have always paid it. And one path we shall never choose, and that is the path of surrender, or submission.
author: John F. Kennedy

quote: Those who dare to fail miserably can achieve greatly.
author: John F. Kennedy

quote: Our most basic common link is that we all inhabit this planet. We all breathe the same air. We all cherish our children's future. And we are all mortal.
author: John F. Kennedy

quote: It is an unfortunate fact that we can secure peace only by preparing for war.
author: John F. Kennedy

quote: Geography has made us neighbors. History has made us friends. Economics has made us partners, and necessity has made us allies. Those whom God has so joined together, let no man put asunder.
author: John F. Kennedy

quote: The greater our knowledge increases the more our ignorance unfolds.
author: John F. Kennedy

quote: The time to repair the roof is when the sun is shining.
author: John F. Kennedy

quote: The great enemy of the truth is very often not the lie, deliberate, contrived and dishonest, but the myth, persistent, persuasive and unrealistic.
author: John F. Kennedy

quote: I think this is the most extraordinary collection of talent, of human knowledge, that has ever been gathered at the White House - with the possible exception of when Thomas Jefferson dined alone.
author: John F. Kennedy

quote: For time and the world do not stand still. Change is the law of life. And those who look only to the past or the present are certain to miss the future.
author: John F. Kennedy

quote: We are tied to the ocean. And when we go back to the sea, whether it is to sail or to watch - we are going back from whence we came.
author: John F. Kennedy

quote: Our problems are man-made, therefore they may be solved by man. And man can be as big as he wants. No problem of human destiny is beyond human beings.
author: John F. Kennedy

quote: We are not here to curse the darkness, but to light the candle that can guide us thru that darkness to a safe and sane future.
author: John F. Kennedy

quote: A man does what he must - in spite of personal consequences, in spite of obstacles and dangers and pressures - and that is the basis of all human morality.
author: John F. Kennedy

quote: The goal of education is the advancement of knowledge and the dissemination of truth.
author: John F. Kennedy

quote: Washington is a city of Southern efficiency and Northern charm.
author: John F. Kennedy

quote: If art is to nourish the roots of our culture, society must set the artist free to follow his vision wherever it takes him.
author: John F. Kennedy

quote: For in the final analysis, our most basic common link is that we all inhabit this small planet. We all breathe the same air. We all cherish our children's futures. And we are all mortal.
author: John F. Kennedy

quote: Mankind must put an end to war before war puts an end to mankind.
author: John F. Kennedy

quote: If we cannot now end our differences, at least we can help make the world safe for diversity.
author: John F. Kennedy

quote: In the long history of the world, only a few generations have been granted the role of defending freedom in its hour of maximum danger. I do not shrink from this responsibility - I welcome it.
author: John F. Kennedy

quote: When power leads man toward arrogance, poetry reminds him of his limitations. When power narrows the area of man's concern, poetry reminds him of the richness and diversity of existence. When power corrupts, poetry cleanses.
author: John F. Kennedy

quote: Tolerance implies no lack of commitment to one's own beliefs. Rather it condemns the oppression or persecution of others.
author: John F. Kennedy

quote: Let both sides seek to invoke the wonders of science instead of its terrors. Together let us explore the stars, conquer the deserts, eradicate disease, tap the ocean depths, and encourage the arts and commerce.
author: John F. Kennedy

quote: I am the man who accompanied Jacqueline Kennedy to Paris, and I have enjoyed it.
author: John F. Kennedy

quote: We must use time as a tool, not as a couch.
author: John F. Kennedy

quote: We would like to live as we once lived, but history will not permit it.
author: John F. Kennedy

quote: A child miseducated is a child lost.
author: John F. Kennedy

quote: Domestic policy can only defeat us; foreign policy can kill us.
author: John F. Kennedy

quote: There is always inequality in life. Some men are killed in a war and some men are wounded and some men never leave the country. Life is unfair.
author: John F. Kennedy

quote: The world is very different now. For man holds in his mortal hands the power to abolish all forms of human poverty, and all forms of human life.
author: John F. Kennedy

quote: Mothers all want their sons to grow up to be president, but they don't want them to become politicians in the process.
author: John F. Kennedy

quote: Peace is a daily, a weekly, a monthly process, gradually changing opinions, slowly eroding old barriers, quietly building new structures.
author: John F. Kennedy

quote: If a free society cannot help the many who are poor, it cannot save the few who are rich.
author: John F. Kennedy

quote: Man is still the most extraordinary computer of all.
author: John F. Kennedy

quote: Communism has never come to power in a country that was not disrupted by war or corruption, or both.
author: John F. Kennedy

quote: Our progress as a nation can be no swifter than our progress in education. The human mind is our fundamental resource.
author: John F. Kennedy

quote: History is a relentless master. It has no present, only the past rushing into the future. To try to hold fast is to be swept aside.
author: John F. Kennedy

quote: The human mind is our fundamental resource.
author: John F. Kennedy

quote: I do not feel obliged to believe that the same God who has endowed us with sense, reason, and intellect has intended us to forgo their use.
author: Galileo Galilei

quote: All truths are easy to understand once they are discovered; the point is to discover them.
author: Galileo Galilei

quote: I have never met a man so ignorant that I couldn't learn something from him.
author: Galileo Galilei

quote: Measure what is measurable, and make measurable what is not so.
author: Galileo Galilei

quote: We cannot teach people anything; we can only help them discover it within themselves.
author: Galileo Galilei

quote: The Bible shows the way to go to heaven, not the way the heavens go.
author: Galileo Galilei

quote: In questions of science, the authority of a thousand is not worth the humble reasoning of a single individual.
author: Galileo Galilei

quote: If I were again beginning my studies, I would follow the advice of Plato and start with mathematics.
author: Galileo Galilei

quote: The sun, with all those planets revolving around it and dependent on it, can still ripen a bunch of grapes as if it had nothing else in the universe to do.
author: Galileo Galilei

quote: The Milky Way is nothing else but a mass of innumerable stars planted together in clusters.
author: Galileo Galilei

quote: Nature is relentless and unchangeable, and it is indifferent as to whether its hidden reasons and actions are understandable to man or not.
author: Galileo Galilei

quote: And yet it moves.
author: Galileo Galilei

quote: By denying scientific principles, one may maintain any paradox.
author: Galileo Galilei

quote: I give infinite thanks to God, who has been pleased to make me the first observer of marvelous things.
author: Galileo Galilei

quote: Philosophy is written in this grand book, the universe, which stands continually open to our gaze. But the book cannot be understood unless one first learns to comprehend the language and read the letters in which it is composed.
author: Galileo Galilei

quote: Where the senses fail us, reason must step in.
author: Galileo Galilei

quote: It is surely harmful to souls to make it a heresy to believe what is proved.
author: Galileo Galilei

quote: I think that in the discussion of natural problems we ought to begin not with the Scriptures, but with experiments, and demonstrations.
author: Galileo Galilei

quote: Facts which at first seem improbable will, even on scant explanation, drop the cloak which has hidden them and stand forth in naked and simple beauty.
author: Galileo Galilei

quote: Who would set a limit to the mind of man? Who would dare assert that we know all there is to be known?
author: Galileo Galilei

quote: It vexes me when they would constrain science by the authority of the Scriptures, and yet do not consider themselves bound to answer reason and experiment.
author: Galileo Galilei

quote: The nature of the human mind is such that unless it is stimulated by images of things acting upon it from without, all remembrance of them passes easily away.
author: Galileo Galilei

quote: I notice that young men go to the universities in order to become doctors or philosophers or anything, so long as it is a title, and that many go in for those professions who are utterly unfit for them, while others who would be very competent are prevented by business or their daily cares, which keep them away from letters.
author: Galileo Galilei

quote: We must say that there are as many squares as there are numbers.
author: Galileo Galilei

quote: He who looks the higher is the more highly distinguished, and turning over the great book of nature (which is the proper object of philosophy) is the way to elevate one's gaze.
author: Galileo Galilei

quote: True independence and freedom can only exist in doing what's right.
author: Brigham Young

quote: Love the giver more than the gift.
author: Brigham Young

quote: I am a firm believer in slavery.
author: Brigham Young

quote: Education is the power to think clearly, the power to act well in the worlds work, and the power to appreciate life.
author: Brigham Young

quote: If I had a choice of educating my daughters or my sons because of opportunity constraints, I would choose to educate my daughters.
author: Brigham Young

quote: Honest hearts produce honest actions.
author: Brigham Young

quote: Remember, a chip on the shoulder is a sure sign of wood higher up.
author: Brigham Young

quote: Any young man who is unmarried at the age of twenty one is a menace to the community.
author: Brigham Young

quote: A good man, is a good man, whether in this church, or out of it.
author: Brigham Young

quote: Never let a day pass that you will have cause to say, I will do better tomorrow.
author: Brigham Young

quote: I don't care about my character here on earth. I don't care about what other people think or say about me, all I care about is my standing before the Lord.
author: Brigham Young

quote: There is no knowledge, no light, no wisdom that you are in possession of, but what you have received it from some source.
author: Brigham Young

quote: I don't care whether the people believe me to be a prophet, seer, or revelator or not - I have been very profitable to this people, and I have seen a good many things, and I have revealed many things.
author: Brigham Young

quote: Brethren, let us mind our own business - that is, the calling the Lord has called us to - to do everything we can to promote the good of the Cause of Truth, and never ask how big we are, or inquire who we are; but let it be, 'What can I do to build up the Kingdom of God upon the Earth?'
author: Brigham Young

quote: If the Devil can only make you think that you are abused or ill treated, and you begin to fret about it, and you give the Devil power over you - in the end, it is as bad as though you had done wrong yourself.
author: Brigham Young

quote: I want to live perfectly above the law, and make it my servant instead of my master.
author: Brigham Young

quote: We should never permit ourselves to do anything that we are not willing to see our children do.
author: Brigham Young

quote: Don't try to tear down other people's religion about their ears, Build up your own perfect structure of truth, and invite your listeners to enter in and enjoy its glories.
author: Brigham Young

quote: Silence may be golden, but can you think of a better way to entertain someone than to listen to him?
author: Brigham Young

quote: Nature is the glass reflecting God, as by the sea reflected is the sun, too glorious to be gazed on in his sphere.
author: Brigham Young

quote: In the adversity of our best friends we often find something that does not displease us.
author: Brigham Young

quote: The biggest labor problem is tomorrow.
author: Brigham Young

quote: Infringe upon the rights of no one. Borrow no tool but what you will return according to promise. Take no wood, nor anything else but what belongs to you - and if you find anything that is not your own, do not hide it away, but report it, that the owner may be found.
author: Brigham Young

quote: Produce what you consume; draw from the native element the necessaries of life. Permit no vitiated taste to lead you into the indulgence of expensive luxuries, which can only be obtained by involving yourselves in debt.
author: Brigham Young

quote: It is wise for us to forget our troubles, there are always new ones to replace them.
author: Brigham Young

quote: Each friend represents a world in us, a world not born until they arrive, and it is only by this meeting that a new world is born.
author: Anais Nin

quote: Dreams are necessary to life.
author: Anais Nin

quote: Life shrinks or expands in proportion to one's courage.
author: Anais Nin

quote: We don't see things as they are, we see them as we are.
author: Anais Nin

quote: Throw your dreams into space like a kite, and you do not know what it will bring back, a new life, a new friend, a new love, a new country.
author: Anais Nin

quote: Love never dies a natural death. It dies because we don't know how to replenish its source. It dies of blindness and errors and betrayals. It dies of illness and wounds; it dies of weariness, of witherings, of tarnishings.
author: Anais Nin

quote: I, with a deeper instinct, choose a man who compels my strength, who makes enormous demands on me, who does not doubt my courage or my toughness, who does not believe me naive or innocent, who has the courage to treat me like a woman.
author: Anais Nin

quote: We travel, some of us forever, to seek other states, other lives, other souls.
author: Anais Nin

quote: I must be a mermaid, Rango. I have no fear of depths and a great fear of shallow living.
author: Anais Nin

quote: Life is a process of becoming, a combination of states we have to go through. Where people fail is that they wish to elect a state and remain in it. This is a kind of death.
author: Anais Nin

quote: I postpone death by living, by suffering, by error, by risking, by giving, by losing.
author: Anais Nin

quote: Age does not protect you from love. But love, to some extent, protects you from age.
author: Anais Nin

quote: Life is truly known only to those who suffer, lose, endure adversity and stumble from defeat to defeat.
author: Anais Nin

quote: People living deeply have no fear of death.
author: Anais Nin

quote: The only abnormality is the incapacity to love.
author: Anais Nin

quote: How wrong it is for a woman to expect the man to build the world she wants, rather than to create it herself.
author: Anais Nin

quote: The possession of knowledge does not kill the sense of wonder and mystery. There is always more mystery.
author: Anais Nin

quote: Do not seek the because - in love there is no because, no reason, no explanation, no solutions.
author: Anais Nin

quote: Each contact with a human being is so rare, so precious, one should preserve it.
author: Anais Nin

quote: Anxiety is love's greatest killer. It makes others feel as you might when a drowning man holds on to you. You want to save him, but you know he will strangle you with his panic.
author: Anais Nin

quote: The personal life deeply lived always expands into truths beyond itself.
author: Anais Nin

quote: I will not be just a tourist in the world of images, just watching images passing by which I cannot live in, make love to, possess as permanent sources of joy and ecstasy.
author: Anais Nin

quote: When we blindly adopt a religion, a political system, a literary dogma, we become automatons. We cease to grow.
author: Anais Nin

quote: Dreams pass into the reality of action. From the actions stems the dream again; and this interdependence produces the highest form of living.
author: Anais Nin

quote: A leaf fluttered in through the window this morning, as if supported by the rays of the sun, a bird settled on the fire escape, joy in the task of coffee, joy accompanied me as I walked.
author: Anais Nin

quote: There are many ways to be free. One of them is to transcend reality by imagination, as I try to do.
author: Anais Nin

quote: We write to taste life twice: in the moment and in retrospection.
author: Anais Nin

quote: There are very few human beings who receive the truth, complete and staggering, by instant illumination. Most of them acquire it fragment by fragment, on a small scale, by successive developments, cellularly, like a laborious mosaic.
author: Anais Nin

quote: I stopped loving my father a long time ago. What remained was the slavery to a pattern.
author: Anais Nin

quote: Our life is composed greatly from dreams, from the unconscious, and they must be brought into connection with action. They must be woven together.
author: Anais Nin

quote: The dream was always running ahead of me. To catch up, to live for a moment in unison with it, that was the miracle.
author: Anais Nin

quote: There is not one big cosmic meaning for all, there is only the meaning we each give to our life, an individual meaning, an individual plot, like an individual novel, a book for each person.
author: Anais Nin

quote: The role of a writer is not to say what we all can say, but what we are unable to say.
author: Anais Nin

quote: My ideas usually come not at my desk writing but in the midst of living.
author: Anais Nin

quote: When you make a world tolerable for yourself, you make a world tolerable for others.
author: Anais Nin

quote: If you do not breathe through writing, if you do not cry out in writing, or sing in writing, then don't write, because our culture has no use for it.
author: Anais Nin

quote: It is the function of art to renew our perception. What we are familiar with we cease to see. The writer shakes up the familiar scene, and, as if by magic, we see a new meaning in it.
author: Anais Nin

quote: Truth is something which can't be told in a few words. Those who simplify the universe only reduce the expansion of its meaning.
author: Anais Nin

quote: If all of us acted in unison as I act individually there would be no wars and no poverty. I have made myself personally responsible for the fate of every human being who has come my way.
author: Anais Nin

quote: It's all right for a woman to be, above all, human. I am a woman first of all.
author: Anais Nin

quote: Living never wore one out so much as the effort not to live.
author: Anais Nin

quote: The human father has to be confronted and recognized as human, as man who created a child and then, by his absence, left the child fatherless and then Godless.
author: Anais Nin

quote: What I cannot love, I overlook. Is that real friendship?
author: Anais Nin

quote: Riding a race bike is an art - a thing that you do because you feel something inside.
author: Valentino Rossi

quote: My normal life is like being on holiday.
author: Valentino Rossi

quote: The most important thing is to have a good relationship with the bike... you have to understand what she wants. I think of a motorcycle as a woman, and I know that sounds silly, but it's true.
author: Valentino Rossi

quote: The great fights with your strongest rivals are always the biggest motivation. When you win easily it's not the same taste.
author: Valentino Rossi

quote: Maybe the bike is more dangerous, but the passion for the car for me is second to the bike.
author: Valentino Rossi

quote: To be a great motorbike racer, the most important thing is passion for the bike.
author: Valentino Rossi

quote: I'm Valentino Rossi. And I want to be a person, not an icon.
author: Valentino Rossi

quote: I never race for records. The motivation to try to beat the record is not enough to continue. You have to enjoy it.
author: Valentino Rossi

quote: I would have probably stolen cars - it would have given me the same adrenaline rush as racing.
author: Valentino Rossi

quote: It is a big problem and so I don't know for sure if I say yes or no to Ferrari.
author: Valentino Rossi

quote: I have a lot of energy after 2 A.M. I like to sleep in the morning. I have some problems at the start of the day.
author: Valentino Rossi

quote: I don't like being famous - it is like a prison. And driving for Ferrari would make it far worse.
author: Valentino Rossi

quote: Once the races begin it's more difficult and there is never that much time for testing.
author: Valentino Rossi

quote: I am able to ride the bike and think clearly about strategy and tyres. I also have positive thinking. I am very constructively critical.
author: Valentino Rossi

quote: I always enjoyed myself a lot in pre-school.
author: Valentino Rossi

quote: It's a big, big advantage because understanding what changes we might make takes time and it takes time to work out settings and to understand everything about the new machine.
author: Valentino Rossi

quote: In my opinion we are at the limit now, and 17 races is really too much. With all the testing that we do now, it means we're always on the bike and it's quite difficult.
author: Valentino Rossi

quote: Also, when I started racing he knew a lot of people and it was more easy for me to find the first bike, so I have a good chance for sure.
author: Valentino Rossi

quote: I race to win. If I am on the bike or in a car it will always be the same.
author: Valentino Rossi

quote: We have the 2004 M1 here for reference, which is useful. It worked well here last year; we won the race and always did fast lap times so it will be interesting to compare it to the new bike and it will help us to understand which parts have improved.
author: Valentino Rossi

quote: Fortunately during my career I have won more or less everything, so I need to enjoy it to have the right motivation.
author: Valentino Rossi

quote: In 2002 the Yamaha was at more or less the same level as the Honda, better in some ways, worse in others. But in the winter of last year between 2002 and 2003, Honda made a big step forward and it seemed as if Yamaha couldn't quite match that improvement.
author: Valentino Rossi

quote: I was lucky. My father raced bikes. He gave me the passion very early. I had my first bike when I was three or four years old.
author: Valentino Rossi

quote: If I test the car for a year I can be quite competitive the next season.
author: Valentino Rossi

quote: To win the Championship in the first year will be hard. We need time to become competitive and win races.
author: Valentino Rossi

quote: The work that we do during the winter is very important; we have a new bike and it's important to develop it during this time, and we start with this test.
author: Valentino Rossi

quote: How do Ferrari know what I'm doing next year when I don't know what I'm doing next week?
author: Valentino Rossi

quote: I have won on Honda and Yamaha so maybe it is interesting to win with a third team, Ducati, who are Italian.
author: Valentino Rossi

quote: My father raced bikes. He gave me the passion very early. I had my first bike when I was three or four years old.
author: Valentino Rossi

quote: But I could also start F1 or rallying. I love rallying much more.
author: Valentino Rossi

quote: You look at Moto3, the races are very exciting. Moto2 is fantastic, and then MotoGP is boring.
author: Valentino Rossi

quote: Maybe if Graziano make another work or another sport I wouldn't have had this passion to be a rider.
author: Valentino Rossi

quote: As for the level of spectacle of the two disciplines, I leave it to the people who watch the races to comment.
author: Valentino Rossi

quote: If you live to be a hundred, I want to live to be a hundred minus one day so I never have to live without you.
author: A. A. Milne

quote: Weeds are flowers too, once you get to know them.
author: A. A. Milne

quote: Organizing is what you do before you do something, so that when you do it, it is not all mixed up.
author: A. A. Milne

quote: It is more fun to talk with someone who doesn't use long, difficult words but rather short, easy words, like 'What about lunch?'
author: A. A. Milne

quote: Did you ever stop to think, and forget to start again?
author: A. A. Milne

quote: One of the advantages of being disorderly is that one is constantly making exciting discoveries.
author: A. A. Milne

quote: The third-rate mind is only happy when it is thinking with the majority. The second-rate mind is only happy when it is thinking with the minority. The first-rate mind is only happy when it is thinking.
author: A. A. Milne

quote: You can't stay in your corner of the forest waiting for others to come to you. You have to go to them sometimes.
author: A. A. Milne

quote: Some people care too much. I think it's called love.
author: A. A. Milne

quote: Don't underestimate the value of doing nothing, of just going along, listening to all the thing you can't hear, and not bothering.
author: A. A. Milne

quote: To the uneducated, an A is just three sticks.
author: A. A. Milne

quote: Never forget me, because if I thought you would, I'd never leave.
author: A. A. Milne

quote: What I say is that, if a fellow really likes potatoes, he must be a pretty decent sort of fellow.
author: A. A. Milne

quote: I suppose that every one of us hopes secretly for immortality; to leave, I mean, a name behind him which will live forever in this world, whatever he may be doing, himself, in the next.
author: A. A. Milne

quote: Golf is so popular simply because it is the best game in the world at which to be bad.
author: A. A. Milne

quote: If one is to be called a liar, one may as well make an effort to deserve the name.
author: A. A. Milne

quote: Bores can be divided into two classes; those who have their own particular subject, and those who do not need a subject.
author: A. A. Milne

quote: My spelling is Wobbly. It's good spelling but it Wobbles, and the letters get in the wrong places.
author: A. A. Milne

quote: The Old Testament is responsible for more atheism, agnosticism, disbelief - call it what you will - than any book ever written. It has emptied more churches than all the counter-attractions of cinema, motor-bicycle and golf course.
author: A. A. Milne

quote: A writer wants something more than money for his work: he wants permanence.
author: A. A. Milne

quote: You will be better advised to watch what we do instead of what we say.
author: A. A. Milne

quote: I gave up writing children's books. I wanted to escape from them as I had once wanted to escape from 'Punch': as I have always wanted to escape. In vain.
author: A. A. Milne

quote: Almost anyone can be an author; the business is to collect money and fame from this state of being.
author: A. A. Milne

quote: Tiggers don't like honey.
author: A. A. Milne

quote: War is something of man's own fostering, and if all mankind renounces it, then it is no longer there.
author: A. A. Milne

quote: A clever conjurer is welcome anywhere, and those of us whose powers of entertainment are limited to the setting of booby-traps or the arranging of apple-pie beds must view with envy the much greater tribute of laughter and applause which is the lot of the prestidigitator with some natural gift for legerdemain.
author: A. A. Milne

quote: I am sure of this: that no one can write a book which children will like unless he write it for himself first.
author: A. A. Milne

quote: Is 'The Wind in the Willows' a children's book? Is 'Alice in Wonderland?' Is 'Treasure Island?' These are masterpieces which we read with pleasure as children, but with how much more pleasure when we are grown-up.
author: A. A. Milne

quote: No sensible author wants anything but praise.
author: A. A. Milne

quote: As I enter a new phase of life and my circle broadens, I start learning new things.
author: Kapil Dev

quote: If you play good cricket, a lot of bad things get hidden.
author: Kapil Dev

quote: Irrespective of any political party, I am a supporter of good people who want to do something for the society.
author: Kapil Dev

quote: The next generation has always been and will be better than the previous one. If it is not, then the world would not be moving forward.
author: Kapil Dev

quote: When you have to work, work with a smile.
author: Kapil Dev

quote: The hunger to win must not die... The appetite has to remain big.
author: Kapil Dev

quote: I always breathe cricket.
author: Kapil Dev

quote: I don't look into negative things. Go past mistakes and look forward.
author: Kapil Dev

quote: Sports should not become routine. It should be about passion.
author: Kapil Dev

quote: All you have to do is to dream big and try to fulfil it.
author: Kapil Dev

quote: I think pride is more important sometimes than making money.
author: Kapil Dev

quote: Selectors can't please everyone, but I am OK if they are working for the benefit of Indian cricket. It's an administrative decision to appoint a selection committee, and I would like to let them do their job.
author: Kapil Dev

quote: Good sports facilities are a blessing.
author: Kapil Dev

quote: If your work becomes a source of enjoyment and a challenge, it will never seem like work - it will be fun. If you ever feel that your work is a burden, there is no point carrying on with it.
author: Kapil Dev

quote: Cricket is very simple... you play till you can sustain.
author: Kapil Dev

quote: In the long run, I believe that honesty is definitely the best policy. One can get away by being dishonest for a short term, but ultimately, honesty is what pays.
author: Kapil Dev

quote: Apart from education, you need good health, and for that, you need to play sports.
author: Kapil Dev

quote: I was a naughty kid. Teachers did not like me much.
author: Kapil Dev

quote: Every person gets negative things, they learn from those negative things, and you become a positive person.
author: Kapil Dev

quote: When you are growing up, everyone will help you. When you reach the top, everyone will start pulling you down. The same people who help you will be the same people who try to pull you down.
author: Kapil Dev

quote: Test cricket is a different sort of cricket altogether. Some players who are good for one-day cricket may be a handicap in a Test match.
author: Kapil Dev

quote: No cricket should be played for at least a month anywhere in the world after a World Cup.
author: Kapil Dev

quote: People often ask me whether I believe in God. I haven't seen God. But I think that one's beliefs are one's God - and, in those terms, yes, God is there.
author: Kapil Dev

quote: Spirituality lies in what you do and how you do it and not what result you get.
author: Kapil Dev

quote: It is always nice when you are honoured. The Lifetime award makes me feel old. I am only 55.
author: Kapil Dev

quote: I, as a cricketer, would like to see 100 counties playing top-flight cricket, just like tennis and football. If I am alive to see that, I will be very happy.
author: Kapil Dev

quote: Certain cricketers are meant to play Test cricket.
author: Kapil Dev

quote: People never expected a boy from a small town to have a life like I did.
author: Kapil Dev

quote: My best wishes are with Indian cricket in general. I wish each one of our cricketers success at the international and domestic level.
author: Kapil Dev

quote: Try and understand: cricket was played by Commonwealth countries only; now it has started in other countries as well, and I am proud of that.
author: Kapil Dev

quote: Speed can't always get you wickets.
author: Kapil Dev

quote: Sports is my passion.
author: Kapil Dev

quote: I never wanted to take autographs, always wanted to give them. To do this, you have to achieve something.
author: Kapil Dev

quote: When I was a boy, cricket was very, very English. Anyone who spoke English and anyone from a big town could play. And that was it.
author: Kapil Dev

quote: I feel that World Cup cricket should be played like football in which all the 160 countries take part. If only a handful of countries are going to keep on playing in the World Cup without making the game popular, I will be a sad man.
author: Kapil Dev

quote: Though teenagers are generally very interested in sports, they must realise that education is the most important thing in their lives. They must find the right balance.
author: Kapil Dev

quote: Virat Kohli has so far shown that he has more ability and talent than anybody else, and if he can play till 32 or 34 with same fitness and without injuries, he will come to a point where not even Vivian Richards neither Sachin Tendulkar had such a record.
author: Kapil Dev

quote: The West Indians and Pakistanis play one-day cricket so well because they play for English counties.
author: Kapil Dev

quote: I never said, 'I wouldn't help a cricketer if he approaches me.'
author: Kapil Dev

quote: There is inspiration all around us.
author: Kapil Dev

quote: Let me clarify it through the national news agency that I am not joining Aam Aadmi Party. There has been reports that I will be officially joining AAP, but I can assure you that nothing of that sort is happening.
author: Kapil Dev

quote: I used to hate any batsman who would not get out in my deliveries.
author: Kapil Dev

quote: The biggest test for any cricketer in England is the weather.
author: Kapil Dev

quote: It isn't easy being a celebrity cricketer in India.
author: Kapil Dev

quote: I have great respect for Jaypee Greens as a company that has produced a truly world class, 24-carat, championship golf course. I am happy to be associated with a company with such outstanding qualities.
author: Kapil Dev

quote: I have no political aspirations. That's it.
author: Kapil Dev

quote: Fast bowling is an art, like spin bowling.
author: Kapil Dev

quote: If I can teach cricket overseas, why wouldn't I do so in my own country?
author: Kapil Dev

quote: Maybe a day will come when we may have to just put on a pair of glasses and see sports events.
author: Kapil Dev

quote: My role models have kept on changing.
author: Kapil Dev

quote: I wasn't a ladies' man.
author: Kapil Dev

quote: If you have two good off spinners, what is the problem in playing both of them.
author: Kapil Dev

quote: All artists are crazy.
author: Kapil Dev

quote: Cricket has become more popular, not me... When the game grows, those who've played it also 'grow.'
author: Kapil Dev

quote: If you are playing on a turning wicket, toss plays an important role. The team that wins the toss gets an opportunity to play on the fresh wicket. You should always prepare the wicket as per team's strength. But a rank turner might backfire.
author: Kapil Dev

quote: When you take risks and things don't go your way, you can be heavily criticised by the media.
author: Kapil Dev

quote: I am not too intelligent.
author: Kapil Dev

quote: I have played cricket on my own terms.
author: Kapil Dev

quote: As a sportsman, my aim was to help sportspersons grow. The idea is to see what is good for sport rather than what's good for individuals.
author: Kapil Dev

quote: As an Indian, I would like to back my government.
author: Kapil Dev

quote: There is pleasure in the pathless woods, there is rapture in the lonely shore, there is society where none intrudes, by the deep sea, and music in its roar; I love not Man the less, but Nature more.
author: Lord Byron

quote: Be thou the rainbow in the storms of life. The evening beam that smiles the clouds away, and tints tomorrow with prophetic ray.
author: Lord Byron

quote: Absence - that common cure of love.
author: Lord Byron

quote: Love will find a way through paths where wolves fear to prey.
author: Lord Byron

quote: Man's love is of man's life a part; it is a woman's whole existence. In her first passion, a woman loves her lover, in all the others all she loves is love.
author: Lord Byron

quote: Sorrow is knowledge, those that know the most must mourn the deepest, the tree of knowledge is not the tree of life.
author: Lord Byron

quote: Always laugh when you can. It is cheap medicine.
author: Lord Byron

quote: The great art of life is sensation, to feel that we exist, even in pain.
author: Lord Byron

quote: All who joy would win must share it. Happiness was born a Twin.
author: Lord Byron

quote: There are four questions of value in life, Don Octavio. What is sacred? Of what is the spirit made? What is worth living for and what is worth dying for? The answer to each is the same. Only love.
author: Lord Byron

quote: I only go out to get me a fresh appetite for being alone.
author: Lord Byron

quote: Then stirs the feeling infinite, so felt In solitude, where we are least alone.
author: Lord Byron

quote: But words are things, and a small drop of ink, Falling like dew, upon a thought, produces That which makes thousands, perhaps millions, think.
author: Lord Byron

quote: Now hatred is by far the longest pleasure; men love in haste but they detest at leisure.
author: Lord Byron

quote: I love not man the less, but Nature more.
author: Lord Byron

quote: The best prophet of the future is the past.
author: Lord Byron

quote: Man, being reasonable, must get drunk; the best of life is but intoxication.
author: Lord Byron

quote: Those who will not reason, are bigots, those who cannot, are fools, and those who dare not, are slaves.
author: Lord Byron

quote: Yes, love indeed is light from heaven; A spark of that immortal fire with angels shared, by Allah given to lift from earth our low desire.
author: Lord Byron

quote: Friendship may, and often does, grow into love, but love never subsides into friendship.
author: Lord Byron

quote: Death, so called, is a thing which makes men weep, And yet a third of life is passed in sleep.
author: Lord Byron

quote: Fools are my theme, let satire be my song.
author: Lord Byron

quote: Adversity is the first path to truth.
author: Lord Byron

quote: Friendship is Love without his wings!
author: Lord Byron

quote: We are all selfish and I no more trust myself than others with a good motive.
author: Lord Byron

quote: There is no instinct like that of the heart.
author: Lord Byron

quote: For truth is always strange; stranger than fiction.
author: Lord Byron

quote: Fame is the thirst of youth.
author: Lord Byron

quote: Between two worlds life hovers like a star, twixt night and morn, upon the horizon's verge.
author: Lord Byron

quote: Men love in haste, but they detest at leisure.
author: Lord Byron

quote: If I don't write to empty my mind, I go mad.
author: Lord Byron

quote: The heart will break, but broken live on.
author: Lord Byron

quote: Ye stars! which are the poetry of heaven!
author: Lord Byron

quote: But what is Hope? Nothing but the paint on the face of Existence; the least touch of truth rubs it off, and then we see what a hollow-cheeked harlot we have got hold of.
author: Lord Byron

quote: Truth is always strange, stranger than fiction.
author: Lord Byron

quote: Roll on, deep and dark blue ocean, roll. Ten thousand fleets sweep over thee in vain. Man marks the earth with ruin, but his control stops with the shore.
author: Lord Byron

quote: Society is now one polished horde, formed of two mighty tries, the Bores and Bored.
author: Lord Byron

quote: For pleasures past I do not grieve, nor perils gathering near; My greatest grief is that I leave nothing that claims a tear.
author: Lord Byron

quote: Though I love my country, I do not love my countrymen.
author: Lord Byron

quote: The 'good old times' - all times when old are good.
author: Lord Byron

quote: There is something pagan in me that I cannot shake off. In short, I deny nothing, but doubt everything.
author: Lord Byron

quote: Prolonged endurance tames the bold.
author: Lord Byron

quote: Why I came here, I know not; where I shall go it is useless to inquire - in the midst of myriads of the living and the dead worlds, stars, systems, infinity, why should I be anxious about an atom?
author: Lord Byron

quote: Life's enchanted cup sparkles near the brim.
author: Lord Byron

quote: Like the measles, love is most dangerous when it comes late in life.
author: Lord Byron

quote: All farewells should be sudden, when forever.
author: Lord Byron

quote: I am sure of nothing so little as my own intentions.
author: Lord Byron

quote: The dew of compassion is a tear.
author: Lord Byron

quote: I know that two and two make four - and should be glad to prove it too if I could - though I must say if by any sort of process I could convert 2 and 2 into five it would give me much greater pleasure.
author: Lord Byron

quote: This man is freed from servile bands, Of hope to rise, or fear to fall; Lord of himself, though not of lands, And leaving nothing, yet hath all.
author: Lord Byron

quote: A woman should never be seen eating or drinking, unless it be lobster salad and Champagne, the only true feminine and becoming viands.
author: Lord Byron

quote: This is the patent age of new inventions for killing bodies, and for saving souls. All propagated with the best intentions.
author: Lord Byron

quote: There is no such thing as a life of passion any more than a continuous earthquake, or an eternal fever. Besides, who would ever shave themselves in such a state?
author: Lord Byron

quote: Who loves, raves.
author: Lord Byron

quote: Her great merit is finding out mine - there is nothing so amiable as discernment.
author: Lord Byron

quote: Shakespeare's name, you may depend on it, stands absurdly too high and will go down.
author: Lord Byron

quote: The busy have no time for tears.
author: Lord Byron

quote: A mistress never is nor can be a friend. While you agree, you are lovers; and when it is over, anything but friends.
author: Lord Byron

quote: Cervantes smiled Spain's chivalry away; A single laugh demolished the right arm Of his country.
author: Lord Byron

quote: There's naught, no doubt, so much the spirit calms as rum and true religion.
author: Lord Byron

quote: I love you the more in that I believe you had liked me for my own sake and for nothing else.
author: John Keats

quote: A thing of beauty is a joy forever: its loveliness increases; it will never pass into nothingness.
author: John Keats

quote: Heard melodies are sweet, but those unheard are sweeter.
author: John Keats

quote: 'Beauty is truth, truth beauty,' - that is all ye know on earth, and all ye need to know.
author: John Keats

quote: Nothing ever becomes real till it is experienced.
author: John Keats

quote: The poetry of the earth is never dead.
author: John Keats

quote: I am certain of nothing but the holiness of the heart's affections, and the truth of imagination.
author: John Keats

quote: The excellency of every art is its intensity, capable of making all disagreeable evaporate.
author: John Keats

quote: Love is my religion - I could die for it.
author: John Keats

quote: My imagination is a monastery and I am its monk.
author: John Keats

quote: Now a soft kiss - Aye, by that kiss, I vow an endless bliss.
author: John Keats

quote: Scenery is fine - but human nature is finer.
author: John Keats

quote: What the imagination seizes as beauty must be truth.
author: John Keats
