quote: Poetry should surprise by a fine excess and not by singularity, it should strike the reader as a wording of his own highest thoughts, and appear almost a remembrance.
author: John Keats

quote: There is nothing stable in the world; uproar's your only music.
author: John Keats

quote: Do you not see how necessary a world of pains and troubles is to school an intelligence and make it a soul?
author: John Keats

quote: Philosophy will clip an angel's wings.
author: John Keats

quote: The only means of strengthening one's intellect is to make up one's mind about nothing, to let the mind be a thoroughfare for all thoughts.
author: John Keats

quote: Here lies one whose name was writ in water.
author: John Keats

quote: You are always new, the last of your kisses was ever the sweetest.
author: John Keats

quote: Much have I traveled in the realms of gold, and many goodly states and kingdoms seen.
author: John Keats

quote: I would sooner fail than not be among the greatest.
author: John Keats

quote: There is an electric fire in human nature tending to purify - so that among these human creatures there is continually some birth of new heroism. The pity is that we must wonder at it, as we should at finding a pearl in rubbish.
author: John Keats

quote: Poetry should... should strike the reader as a wording of his own highest thoughts, and appear almost a remembrance.
author: John Keats

quote: With a great poet the sense of Beauty overcomes every other consideration, or rather obliterates all consideration.
author: John Keats

quote: Poetry should be great and unobtrusive, a thing which enters into one's soul, and does not startle it or amaze it with itself, but with its subject.
author: John Keats

quote: I will give you a definition of a proud man: he is a man who has neither vanity nor wisdom one filled with hatreds cannot be vain, neither can he be wise.
author: John Keats

quote: He ne'er is crowned with immortality Who fears to follow where airy voices lead.
author: John Keats

quote: Though a quarrel in the streets is a thing to be hated, the energies displayed in it are fine; the commonest man shows a grace in his quarrel.
author: John Keats

quote: It appears to me that almost any man may like the spider spin from his own inwards his own airy citadel.
author: John Keats

quote: I have been astonished that men could die martyrs for religion - I have shuddered at it. I shudder no more - I could be martyred for my religion - Love is my religion - I could die for that.
author: John Keats

quote: There is not a fiercer hell than the failure in a great object.
author: John Keats

quote: I am in that temper that if I were under water I would scarcely kick to come to the top.
author: John Keats

quote: Land and sea, weakness and decline are great separators, but death is the great divorcer for ever.
author: John Keats

quote: You speak of Lord Byron and me; there is this great difference between us. He describes what he sees I describe what I imagine. Mine is the hardest task.
author: John Keats

quote: Praise or blame has but a momentary effect on the man whose love of beauty in the abstract makes him a severe critic on his own works.
author: John Keats

quote: The Public - a thing I cannot help looking upon as an enemy, and which I cannot address without feelings of hostility.
author: John Keats

quote: I have two luxuries to brood over in my walks, your loveliness and the hour of my death. O that I could have possession of them both in the same minute.
author: John Keats

quote: I feel you can be down and out but if you are determined, nothing can stop you from winning.
author: Siddharth Shukla

quote: To be honest, I am very comfortable with myself.
author: Siddharth Shukla

quote: I am the last person on Earth who can be diplomatic. I say what I actually feel.
author: Siddharth Shukla

quote: I want my future wife or girlfriend to be herself.
author: Siddharth Shukla

quote: Reality shows make you more bold and you learn new skills like dancing, anchoring.
author: Siddharth Shukla

quote: I am a morning person and the first task for me in the morning is to hit the gym.
author: Siddharth Shukla

quote: India's Got Talent' is one of the biggest platforms for talent across the world.
author: Siddharth Shukla

quote: I don't have any issue with people seeing my real self.
author: Siddharth Shukla

quote: I mean there's something I have achieved in life, even if it's little, and if people write about it, then it's fine.
author: Siddharth Shukla

quote: I love to dance, but the flip side is that I can't dance.
author: Siddharth Shukla

quote: What I look for in a girl is honesty.
author: Siddharth Shukla

quote: I don't think it makes sense to set high goals about how my ideal woman should be. It is like calling for trouble. That would make one close-minded and not open to meeting different kinds of people.
author: Siddharth Shukla

quote: TV is one of the biggest mediums, and over time, it will get bigger.
author: Siddharth Shukla

quote: My work will speak for me. In fact, I never had a PR and I still don't.
author: Siddharth Shukla

quote: I am really grateful to 'Balika Vadhu' for the recognition I have got because of it. People know me and like me because of it.
author: Siddharth Shukla

quote: I have been a pampered boy, the youngest in the family with two elder sisters. I have always had someone around me, usually my mom, to take care of everything for me.
author: Siddharth Shukla

quote: I have a confession to make - I am very fond of junk food.
author: Siddharth Shukla

quote: It's important that we treat our bodies with respect because it's what we have to make do with as long as we live.
author: Siddharth Shukla

quote: In 'BV,' every actor's performance touches your heart. The team on the show is dedicated, which inspires me a lot.
author: Siddharth Shukla

quote: I feel blessed to be working with a banner like Dharma Productions.
author: Siddharth Shukla

quote: After my debut film, I was doing reality shows and hosting so it was not that I had nothing else to do.
author: Siddharth Shukla

quote: The food in Mathura is authentic and delicious. Mathura is famous for its Chana Chidwa which was my cheat snack for the two days I spent there.
author: Siddharth Shukla

quote: I don't think the audience for film or TV is different. I think they are the same people who go out on weekends.
author: Siddharth Shukla

quote: I come from a school of thoughts where I actually don't plan anything.
author: Siddharth Shukla

quote: My only problem, and this has been a constant worry on television, is time management. The deadlines on television are killing.
author: Siddharth Shukla

quote: There was a time when I really wanted to do films, but they didn't come my way. I would come close and the next day suddenly I'd realise that I am not a part of the film anymore. So that's how television happened.
author: Siddharth Shukla

quote: I don't have a type. I am more of a sapiosexual person. The girl has to be intelligent.
author: Siddharth Shukla

quote: I don't have any fears.
author: Siddharth Shukla

quote: Since I have already connected with fans on TV, I don't fear losing out on my movie fans, even if I am away from the silver screen for a long time.
author: Siddharth Shukla

quote: I have been tagged mischievous since childhood and was known as a prankster.
author: Siddharth Shukla

quote: I have never decided on how to plan my career moves.
author: Siddharth Shukla

quote: I was a very protected and confused kid till 24. It was after then, that I started taking my life seriously.
author: Siddharth Shukla

quote: As a model, only a limited number of people knew about me.
author: Siddharth Shukla

quote: I sleep early and I don't party.
author: Siddharth Shukla

quote: Television is growing. It is a huge market for great content.
author: Siddharth Shukla

quote: Web series are a way forward. It is a space where creative minds can express themselves without the fear of censor board.
author: Siddharth Shukla

quote: I was a child who was interested in sports, and represented my school in football, cricket, badminton and table tennis.
author: Siddharth Shukla

quote: I am not a dancer and for me, to learn the art is fun. It gives you the confidence that you can dance.
author: Siddharth Shukla

quote: I don't mind falling in love with an actress. I don't have any reservations.
author: Siddharth Shukla

quote: hooting for 'Savdhaan India' in Mathura made me realise that no matter what place you come from be it a holy city, crime still prevails.
author: Siddharth Shukla

quote: Jhalak Dikhhla Jaa 6' was the turning point in my career.
author: Siddharth Shukla

quote: Amitabh Bachchan's role in 'Deewar'... I'd love to do that if someone does a remake.
author: Siddharth Shukla

quote: As for me I may not have relatives in the film industry. But I grew up in Mumbai as an avid moviegoer. So I don't feel like an outsider.
author: Siddharth Shukla

quote: Films are something that happened by chance.
author: Siddharth Shukla

quote: Balika Vadhu' is the best thing to have happened to me.
author: Siddharth Shukla

quote: Televison is time bound. Whereas a movie has time. You can't write a script for television and keep it for one year.
author: Siddharth Shukla

quote: I wake up at 5:30 and head to the gym and reach the sets by 8:30. So there is nothing to write about me. But people have to say something, so they make up some gossip. It's okay I guess.
author: Siddharth Shukla

quote: Acting is acting at the end of the day. How does it matter if it is in films or on TV?
author: Siddharth Shukla

quote: I am not one of those actors who will abandon my flagship serial, my main claim to fame, just because I've done a hit movie.
author: Siddharth Shukla

quote: But the whole viewership of 'Balika Vadhu' is more than all shows of mine put together. The show has a lot of reach and that has worked for me.
author: Siddharth Shukla

quote: Link-ups go hand-in-hand with TV shows. You do a show and you get linked with your co-star.
author: Siddharth Shukla

quote: I enjoy coming to Ahmedabad. The city is really awesome and people here are warm and hospitable.
author: Siddharth Shukla

quote: Humpty' was something I had to do. I had to stretch myself as an actor.
author: Siddharth Shukla

quote: When not shooting, I love to catch up on my sleep.
author: Siddharth Shukla

quote: My lunch is the staple Indian meal - rotis, vegetables and dal. But instead of wheat rotis, I have rotis made of bran or barley.
author: Siddharth Shukla

quote: This entire journey from 'Balika' to 'Jhalak' to 'Humpty' has been a dream.
author: Siddharth Shukla

quote: Of course, I'd love to do Bollywood.
author: Siddharth Shukla

quote: I can't take up every film that is being offered to me.
author: Siddharth Shukla

quote: Trying times will begin when I will take up my second film as that's when people will take me more seriously. I will have to prove myself too.
author: Siddharth Shukla

quote: I am only looking forward to good film script. It doesn't matter if the role is a supporting or a standalone role.
author: Siddharth Shukla

quote: Victory has a thousand fathers, but defeat is an orphan.
author: John F. Kennedy

quote: Change is the law of life. And those who look only to the past or present are certain to miss the future.
author: John F. Kennedy

quote: As we express our gratitude, we must never forget that the highest appreciation is not to utter words, but to live by them.
author: John F. Kennedy

quote: A nation that is afraid to let its people judge the truth and falsehood in an open market is a nation that is afraid of its people.
author: John F. Kennedy

quote: Physical fitness is not only one of the most important keys to a healthy body, it is the basis of dynamic and creative intellectual activity.
author: John F. Kennedy

quote: My fellow Americans, ask not what your country can do for you, ask what you can do for your country.
author: John F. Kennedy

quote: Let us never negotiate out of fear. But let us never fear to negotiate.
author: John F. Kennedy

quote: Let us not seek the Republican answer or the Democratic answer, but the right answer. Let us not seek to fix the blame for the past. Let us accept our own responsibility for the future.
author: John F. Kennedy

quote: The ignorance of one voter in a democracy impairs the security of all.
author: John F. Kennedy

quote: There are risks and costs to action. But they are far less than the long range risks of comfortable inaction.
author: John F. Kennedy

quote: Forgive your enemies, but never forget their names.
author: John F. Kennedy

quote: Those who make peaceful revolution impossible will make violent revolution inevitable.
author: John F. Kennedy

quote: The pay is good and I can walk to work.
author: John F. Kennedy

quote: Things do not happen. Things are made to happen.
author: John F. Kennedy

quote: Conformity is the jailer of freedom and the enemy of growth.
author: John F. Kennedy

quote: Let every nation know, whether it wishes us well or ill, that we shall pay any price, bear any burden, meet any hardship, support any friend, oppose any foe to assure the survival and the success of liberty.
author: John F. Kennedy

quote: Efforts and courage are not enough without purpose and direction.
author: John F. Kennedy

quote: When written in Chinese, the word 'crisis' is composed of two characters. One represents danger and the other represents opportunity.
author: John F. Kennedy

quote: A man may die, nations may rise and fall, but an idea lives on.
author: John F. Kennedy

quote: Leadership and learning are indispensable to each other.
author: John F. Kennedy

quote: Too often we... enjoy the comfort of opinion without the discomfort of thought.
author: John F. Kennedy

quote: The cost of freedom is always high, but Americans have always paid it. And one path we shall never choose, and that is the path of surrender, or submission.
author: John F. Kennedy

quote: Those who dare to fail miserably can achieve greatly.
author: John F. Kennedy

quote: Our most basic common link is that we all inhabit this planet. We all breathe the same air. We all cherish our children's future. And we are all mortal.
author: John F. Kennedy

quote: It is an unfortunate fact that we can secure peace only by preparing for war.
author: John F. Kennedy

quote: Geography has made us neighbors. History has made us friends. Economics has made us partners, and necessity has made us allies. Those whom God has so joined together, let no man put asunder.
author: John F. Kennedy

quote: The greater our knowledge increases the more our ignorance unfolds.
author: John F. Kennedy

quote: The time to repair the roof is when the sun is shining.
author: John F. Kennedy

quote: The great enemy of the truth is very often not the lie, deliberate, contrived and dishonest, but the myth, persistent, persuasive and unrealistic.
author: John F. Kennedy

quote: I think this is the most extraordinary collection of talent, of human knowledge, that has ever been gathered at the White House - with the possible exception of when Thomas Jefferson dined alone.
author: John F. Kennedy

quote: For time and the world do not stand still. Change is the law of life. And those who look only to the past or the present are certain to miss the future.
author: John F. Kennedy

quote: We are tied to the ocean. And when we go back to the sea, whether it is to sail or to watch - we are going back from whence we came.
author: John F. Kennedy

quote: Our problems are man-made, therefore they may be solved by man. And man can be as big as he wants. No problem of human destiny is beyond human beings.
author: John F. Kennedy

quote: We are not here to curse the darkness, but to light the candle that can guide us thru that darkness to a safe and sane future.
author: John F. Kennedy

quote: A man does what he must - in spite of personal consequences, in spite of obstacles and dangers and pressures - and that is the basis of all human morality.
author: John F. Kennedy

quote: The goal of education is the advancement of knowledge and the dissemination of truth.
author: John F. Kennedy

quote: Washington is a city of Southern efficiency and Northern charm.
author: John F. Kennedy

quote: If art is to nourish the roots of our culture, society must set the artist free to follow his vision wherever it takes him.
author: John F. Kennedy

quote: For in the final analysis, our most basic common link is that we all inhabit this small planet. We all breathe the same air. We all cherish our children's futures. And we are all mortal.
author: John F. Kennedy

quote: Mankind must put an end to war before war puts an end to mankind.
author: John F. Kennedy

quote: If we cannot now end our differences, at least we can help make the world safe for diversity.
author: John F. Kennedy

quote: In the long history of the world, only a few generations have been granted the role of defending freedom in its hour of maximum danger. I do not shrink from this responsibility - I welcome it.
author: John F. Kennedy

quote: When power leads man toward arrogance, poetry reminds him of his limitations. When power narrows the area of man's concern, poetry reminds him of the richness and diversity of existence. When power corrupts, poetry cleanses.
author: John F. Kennedy

quote: Tolerance implies no lack of commitment to one's own beliefs. Rather it condemns the oppression or persecution of others.
author: John F. Kennedy

quote: Let both sides seek to invoke the wonders of science instead of its terrors. Together let us explore the stars, conquer the deserts, eradicate disease, tap the ocean depths, and encourage the arts and commerce.
author: John F. Kennedy

quote: I am the man who accompanied Jacqueline Kennedy to Paris, and I have enjoyed it.
author: John F. Kennedy

quote: We must use time as a tool, not as a couch.
author: John F. Kennedy

quote: We would like to live as we once lived, but history will not permit it.
author: John F. Kennedy

quote: A child miseducated is a child lost.
author: John F. Kennedy

quote: Domestic policy can only defeat us; foreign policy can kill us.
author: John F. Kennedy

quote: There is always inequality in life. Some men are killed in a war and some men are wounded and some men never leave the country. Life is unfair.
author: John F. Kennedy

quote: The world is very different now. For man holds in his mortal hands the power to abolish all forms of human poverty, and all forms of human life.
author: John F. Kennedy

quote: Mothers all want their sons to grow up to be president, but they don't want them to become politicians in the process.
author: John F. Kennedy

quote: Peace is a daily, a weekly, a monthly process, gradually changing opinions, slowly eroding old barriers, quietly building new structures.
author: John F. Kennedy

quote: If a free society cannot help the many who are poor, it cannot save the few who are rich.
author: John F. Kennedy

quote: Man is still the most extraordinary computer of all.
author: John F. Kennedy

quote: Communism has never come to power in a country that was not disrupted by war or corruption, or both.
author: John F. Kennedy

quote: Our progress as a nation can be no swifter than our progress in education. The human mind is our fundamental resource.
author: John F. Kennedy

quote: History is a relentless master. It has no present, only the past rushing into the future. To try to hold fast is to be swept aside.
author: John F. Kennedy

quote: The human mind is our fundamental resource.
author: John F. Kennedy

quote: The power of the lawyer is in the uncertainty of the law.
author: Jeremy Bentham

quote: It is the greatest good to the greatest number of people which is the measure of right and wrong.
author: Jeremy Bentham

quote: The said truth is that it is the greatest happiness of the greatest number that is the measure of right and wrong.
author: Jeremy Bentham

quote: Stretching his hand up to reach the stars, too often man forgets the flowers at his feet.
author: Jeremy Bentham

quote: Lawyers are the only persons in whom ignorance of the law is not punished.
author: Jeremy Bentham

quote: The question is not, 'Can they reason?' nor, 'Can they talk?' but rather, 'Can they suffer?'
author: Jeremy Bentham

quote: The greatest happiness of the greatest number is the foundation of morals and legislation.
author: Jeremy Bentham

quote: All punishment is mischief; all punishment in itself is evil.
author: Jeremy Bentham

quote: Nature has placed mankind under the governance of two sovereign masters, pain and pleasure. It is for them alone to point out what we ought to do, as well as to determine what we shall do.
author: Jeremy Bentham

quote: Every law is an infraction of liberty.
author: Jeremy Bentham

quote: He who thinks and thinks for himself, will always have a claim to thanks; it is no matter whether it be right or wrong, so as it be explicit. If it is right, it will serve as a guide to direct; if wrong, as a beacon to warn.
author: Jeremy Bentham

quote: As to the evil which results from a censorship, it is impossible to measure it, for it is impossible to tell where it ends.
author: Jeremy Bentham

quote: Tyranny and anarchy are never far apart.
author: Jeremy Bentham

quote: Secrecy, being an instrument of conspiracy, ought never to be the system of a regular government.
author: Jeremy Bentham

quote: It is vain to talk of the interest of the community, without understanding what is the interest of the individual.
author: Jeremy Bentham

quote: No power of government ought to be employed in the endeavor to establish any system or article of belief on the subject of religion.
author: Jeremy Bentham

quote: The principle of asceticism never was, nor ever can be, consistently pursued by any living creature. Let but one tenth part of the inhabitants of the earth pursue it consistently, and in a day's time they will have turned it into a Hell.
author: Jeremy Bentham

quote: The age we live in is a busy age; in which knowledge is rapidly advancing towards perfection.
author: Jeremy Bentham

quote: Happiness often sneaks in through a door you didn't know you left open.
author: John Barrymore

quote: A man is not old until regrets take the place of dreams.
author: John Barrymore

quote: Why is there so much month left at the end of the money?
author: John Barrymore

quote: The trouble with life is that there are so many beautiful women and so little time.
author: John Barrymore

quote: Love is the delightful interval between meeting a beautiful girl and discovering that she looks like a haddock.
author: John Barrymore

quote: I would like to find a stew that will give me heartburn immediately, instead of at three o clock in the morning.
author: John Barrymore

quote: My wife was too beautiful for words, but not for arguments.
author: John Barrymore

quote: When archaeologists discover the missing arms of Venus de Milo, they will find she was wearing boxing gloves.
author: John Barrymore

quote: Sex: the thing that takes up the least amount of time and causes the most amount of trouble.
author: John Barrymore

quote: You can only be as good as you dare to be bad.
author: John Barrymore

quote: You never realize how short a month is until you pay alimony.
author: John Barrymore

quote: The good die young, because they see it's no use living if you have got to be good.
author: John Barrymore

quote: My wife is the kind of girl who will not go anywhere without her mother, and her mother will go anywhere.
author: John Barrymore

quote: Die? I should say not, dear fellow. No Barrymore would allow such a conventional thing to happen to him.
author: John Barrymore

quote: In Genesis, it says that it is not good for a man to be alone; but sometimes it is a great relief.
author: John Barrymore

quote: I've read some of your modern free verse and wonder who set it free.
author: John Barrymore

quote: If it isn't the sheriff, it's the finance company; I've got more attachments on me than a vacuum cleaner.
author: John Barrymore

quote: America is the country where you can buy a lifetime supply of aspirin For one dollar and use it up in two weeks.
author: John Barrymore

quote: I am thinking of taking a fifth wife. Why not? Solomon had a thousand wives and he is a synonym for wisdom.
author: John Barrymore

quote: You can't drown yourself in drink. I've tried, you float.
author: John Barrymore

quote: Independence is happiness.
author: Susan B. Anthony

quote: I distrust those people who know so well what God wants them to do, because I notice it always coincides with their own desires.
author: Susan B. Anthony

quote: Failure is impossible.
author: Susan B. Anthony

quote: I declare to you that woman must not depend upon the protection of man, but must be taught to protect herself, and there I take my stand.
author: Susan B. Anthony

quote: No self-respecting woman should wish or work for the success of a party who ignores her sex.
author: Susan B. Anthony

quote: Suffrage is the pivotal right.
author: Susan B. Anthony

quote: Men, their rights, and nothing more; women, their rights, and nothing less.
author: Susan B. Anthony

quote: It was we, the people; not we, the white male citizens; nor yet we, the male citizens; but we, the whole people, who formed the Union. And we formed it, not to give the blessings of liberty, but to secure them; not to the half of ourselves and the half of our posterity, but to the whole people - women as well as men.
author: Susan B. Anthony

quote: Organize, agitate, educate, must be our war cry.
author: Susan B. Anthony

quote: No man is good enough to govern any woman without her consent.
author: Susan B. Anthony

quote: The older I get, the greater power I seem to have to help the world; I am like a snowball - the further I am rolled the more I gain.
author: Susan B. Anthony

quote: There never will be complete equality until women themselves help to make laws and elect lawmakers.
author: Susan B. Anthony

quote: Trust me that as I ignore all law to help the slave, so will I ignore it all to protect an enslaved woman.
author: Susan B. Anthony

quote: It is downright mockery to talk to women of their enjoyment of the blessings of liberty while they are denied the use of the only means of securing them provided by this democratic-republican government: the ballot.
author: Susan B. Anthony

quote: I shall earnestly and persistently continue to urge all women to the practical recognition of the old Revolutionary maxim. Resistance to tyranny is obedience to God.
author: Susan B. Anthony

quote: I think the girl who is able to earn her own living and pay her own way should be as happy as anybody on earth. The sense of independence and security is very sweet.
author: Susan B. Anthony

quote: Whoever controls work and wages, controls morals.
author: Susan B. Anthony

quote: Women, we might as well be dogs baying the moon as petitioners without the right to vote!
author: Susan B. Anthony

quote: It is poor rule that won't work more ways than one.
author: Susan B. Anthony

quote: The day may be approaching when the whole world will recognize woman as the equal of man.
author: Susan B. Anthony

quote: I do not demand equal pay for any women save those who do equal work in value. Scorn to be coddled by your employers; make them understand that you are in their service as workers, not as women.
author: Susan B. Anthony

quote: An oligarchy of race, where the Saxon rules the African, might be endured; but this oligarchy of sex which makes father, brothers, husband, sons, the oligarchs over the mother and sisters, the wife and daughters of every household... carries discord and rebellion into every home of the nation.
author: Susan B. Anthony

quote: She who succeeds in gaining the mastery of the bicycle will gain the mastery of life.
author: Susan B. Anthony

quote: If women will not accept marriage with subjection, nor men proffer it without, there is, there can be, no alternative. The women who will not be ruled must live without marriage. And during this transition period... single women make comfortable and attractive homes for themselves.
author: Susan B. Anthony

quote: There is not a woman born who desires to eat the bread of dependence.
author: Susan B. Anthony

quote: Modern invention has banished the spinning wheel, and the same law of progress makes the woman of today a different woman from her grandmother.
author: Susan B. Anthony

quote: Oh, if I could but live another century and see the fruition of all the work for women! There is so much yet to be done.
author: Susan B. Anthony

quote: Cautious, careful people, always casting about to preserve their reputations... can never effect a reform.
author: Susan B. Anthony

quote: Are you going to cater to the whims and prejudices of people? We draw out from other people our own thought. If, when you go out to organize, you go with a broad spirit, you will create and call out breadth and toleration. You had better organize one woman on a broad platform than 10,000 on a narrow platform of intolerance and bigotry.
author: Susan B. Anthony

quote: The Declaration of Independence, the United States Constitution, the constitutions of the several states, and the organic laws of the territories all alike propose to protect the people in the exercise of their God-given rights. Not one of them pretends to bestow rights.
author: Susan B. Anthony

quote: The worst enemy women have is in the pulpit.
author: Susan B. Anthony

quote: Join the union, girls, and together say Equal Pay for Equal Work.
author: Susan B. Anthony

quote: Wherever, on the face of the globe or on the page of history, you show me a disfranchised class, I will show you a degraded class of labor.
author: Susan B. Anthony

quote: The principle of self-government cannot be violated with impunity. The individual's right to it is sacred - regardless of class, caste, race, color, sex or any other accident or incident of birth.
author: Susan B. Anthony

quote: The only question left to be settled now is: Are women persons? And I hardly believe any of our opponents will have the hardihood to say they are not.
author: Susan B. Anthony

quote: For every betrayed woman, there is always the betrayer, man.
author: Susan B. Anthony

quote: We throw to the winds the old dogma that governments can give rights. Before governments were organized, no one denies that each individual possessed the right to protect his own life, liberty and property.
author: Susan B. Anthony

quote: To think, I have had more than 60 years of hard struggle for a little liberty, and then to die without it seems so cruel.
author: Susan B. Anthony

quote: I have given my life and all I am to it, and now I want my last act to be to give it all I have, to the last cent.
author: Susan B. Anthony

quote: Marriage, to women as to men, must be a luxury, not a necessity; an incident of life, not all of it.
author: Susan B. Anthony

quote: I always distrust people who know so much about what God wants them to do to their fellows.
author: Susan B. Anthony

quote: I do not consider divorce an evil by any means. It is just as much a refuge for women married to brutal men as Canada was to the slaves of brutal masters.
author: Susan B. Anthony

quote: I don't want to die as long as I can work; the minute I can not, I want to go.
author: Susan B. Anthony

quote: Being persons, then, women are citizens; and no state has a right to make any new law, or to enforce any old law, that shall abridge their privileges or immunities.
author: Susan B. Anthony

quote: If all the rich and all of the church people should send their children to the public schools they would feel bound to concentrate their money on improving these schools until they met the highest ideals.
author: Susan B. Anthony

quote: White men have always controlled their wives' wages. Colored men were not able to do so until they themselves became free. Then they owned both their wives and their wages.
author: Susan B. Anthony

quote: Here, in this very first paragraph of the Declaration, is the assertion of the natural right of all to the ballot; for how can 'the consent of the governed' be given if the right to vote be denied?
author: Susan B. Anthony

quote: The work of woman is not to lessen the severity or the certainty of the penalty for the violation of the moral law, but to prevent this violation by the removal of the causes which lead to it.
author: Susan B. Anthony

quote: What you should do is to say to outsiders that a Christian has neither more nor less rights in our association than an atheist.
author: Susan B. Anthony

quote: You would better educate ten women into the practice of liberal principles than to organize a thousand on a platform of intolerance and bigotry.
author: Susan B. Anthony

quote: Woman must have a purse of her own, and how can this be so long as the law denies to the wife all right to both the individual and the joint earnings?
author: Susan B. Anthony

quote: I stand and rejoice every time I see a woman ride by on a wheel.
author: Susan B. Anthony

quote: Resolved, that the women of this nation in 1876, have greater cause for discontent, rebellion and revolution than the men of 1776.
author: Susan B. Anthony

quote: No one can doubt that the sufferings of the sober, virtuous woman, in legal subjection to the mastership of a drunken, immoral husband and father over herself and children, not only from physical abuse, but from spiritual shame and humiliation, must be such as the man himself can not possibly comprehend.
author: Susan B. Anthony

quote: I have encountered riotous mobs and have been hung in effigy, but my motto is: Men's rights are nothing more. Women's rights are nothing less.
author: Susan B. Anthony

quote: This is rather different from the receptions I used to get fifty years ago. They threw things at me then but they were not roses.
author: Susan B. Anthony

quote: I do not feel obliged to believe that the same God who has endowed us with sense, reason, and intellect has intended us to forgo their use.
author: Galileo Galilei

quote: All truths are easy to understand once they are discovered; the point is to discover them.
author: Galileo Galilei

quote: I have never met a man so ignorant that I couldn't learn something from him.
author: Galileo Galilei

quote: Measure what is measurable, and make measurable what is not so.
author: Galileo Galilei

quote: We cannot teach people anything; we can only help them discover it within themselves.
author: Galileo Galilei

quote: The Bible shows the way to go to heaven, not the way the heavens go.
author: Galileo Galilei

quote: In questions of science, the authority of a thousand is not worth the humble reasoning of a single individual.
author: Galileo Galilei

quote: If I were again beginning my studies, I would follow the advice of Plato and start with mathematics.
author: Galileo Galilei

quote: The sun, with all those planets revolving around it and dependent on it, can still ripen a bunch of grapes as if it had nothing else in the universe to do.
author: Galileo Galilei

quote: The Milky Way is nothing else but a mass of innumerable stars planted together in clusters.
author: Galileo Galilei

quote: Nature is relentless and unchangeable, and it is indifferent as to whether its hidden reasons and actions are understandable to man or not.
author: Galileo Galilei

quote: And yet it moves.
author: Galileo Galilei

quote: By denying scientific principles, one may maintain any paradox.
author: Galileo Galilei

quote: I give infinite thanks to God, who has been pleased to make me the first observer of marvelous things.
author: Galileo Galilei

quote: Philosophy is written in this grand book, the universe, which stands continually open to our gaze. But the book cannot be understood unless one first learns to comprehend the language and read the letters in which it is composed.
author: Galileo Galilei

quote: Where the senses fail us, reason must step in.
author: Galileo Galilei

quote: It is surely harmful to souls to make it a heresy to believe what is proved.
author: Galileo Galilei

quote: I think that in the discussion of natural problems we ought to begin not with the Scriptures, but with experiments, and demonstrations.
author: Galileo Galilei

quote: Facts which at first seem improbable will, even on scant explanation, drop the cloak which has hidden them and stand forth in naked and simple beauty.
author: Galileo Galilei

quote: Who would set a limit to the mind of man? Who would dare assert that we know all there is to be known?
author: Galileo Galilei

quote: It vexes me when they would constrain science by the authority of the Scriptures, and yet do not consider themselves bound to answer reason and experiment.
author: Galileo Galilei

quote: The nature of the human mind is such that unless it is stimulated by images of things acting upon it from without, all remembrance of them passes easily away.
author: Galileo Galilei

quote: I notice that young men go to the universities in order to become doctors or philosophers or anything, so long as it is a title, and that many go in for those professions who are utterly unfit for them, while others who would be very competent are prevented by business or their daily cares, which keep them away from letters.
author: Galileo Galilei

quote: We must say that there are as many squares as there are numbers.
author: Galileo Galilei

quote: He who looks the higher is the more highly distinguished, and turning over the great book of nature (which is the proper object of philosophy) is the way to elevate one's gaze.
author: Galileo Galilei

quote: In the land of the skunks, he who has half a nose is king.
author: Chris Farley

quote: I don't know what the future holds. All I know is, I'm good today. Real good.
author: Chris Farley

quote: You enter strong and you exit strong, and you're going to be OK.
author: Chris Farley

quote: There's no control in life, is there? There's only one who's in control, and He'll take me when He wants me. I don't want to know about it. It's none of my business. But when it happens, I just ask that it won't be painful and that He forgives me my sins.
author: Chris Farley

quote: Everybody laughs when fatty falls down.
author: Chris Farley

quote: People... need a time to laugh. It's up to us to bonk ourselves on the head and slip on a banana peel so the average guy can say, 'I may be bad, honey, but I'm not as much of an idiot as that guy on the screen.'
author: Chris Farley

quote: The point is, how do you know the Guarantee Fairy isn't a crazy glue sniffer.
author: Chris Farley

quote: Basically, I only play one character; I just play him at different volumes.
author: Chris Farley

quote: I signed on as the clown, and, by golly, I'll keep up my end of the bargain.
author: Chris Farley

quote: I want to live fast and die young.
author: Chris Farley

quote: I remember one time when all the nuns in my Catholic grade school got around in a semicircle, me and Mom in the middle, and they said, 'Mrs. Farley, the children at school are laughing at Christopher, not with him.' I thought, 'Who cares? As long as they're laughing.'
author: Chris Farley

quote: I was glad to be sober, but after ninety days, people weren't patting me on the back anymore, sayin', 'Good job on the sobriety! Go get 'em!'
author: Chris Farley

quote: Although I love this kind of comedy, sometimes I feel trapped by always having to be the most outrageous guy in the room. In particular, I'm working on trying not to be that guy in my private life.
author: Chris Farley

quote: I can't help it. I want to be a good Catholic, but I'm a hedonist.
author: Chris Farley

quote: The great comics can fall on their faces, but then they can say, 'Oh, baby, you're the greatest.' They show their heart and their vulnerability.
author: Chris Farley

quote: Once I thought that if I just had enough in the bank, if I had enough fame, that it would be all right. But I'm a human being like everyone else. I'm not exempt.
author: Chris Farley

quote: I seem to get motivated a few months at a time, and then something stressful breaks the routine, and I just fold.
author: Chris Farley

quote: New York was scary, coming from the Midwest. At first, I thought I'd come in all cocky, like, 'I'm gonna bring this town to its knees!' After about a month, I was like, 'I wanna go home.'
author: Chris Farley

quote: I have a nice apartment now that's all taken care of. I make my bed every day.
author: Chris Farley

quote: I still have to work on my weight and some of my other demons.
author: Chris Farley

quote: Everyone is treating it like a Hollywood story. In Madison, it's a neighborhood story.
author: Chris Farley

quote: I have a tendency toward the pleasures of the flesh. It's a battle for me, as far as weight and things like that. But I'm curbing them because I want to continue to do comedy, and the two don't mix. So I try to fight those demons.
author: Chris Farley

quote: I was in the Pritikin Center in Santa Monica once, trying to lose 30 or 40 pounds in a month. I'd work... on a treadmill and with the weights, but it was driving me nuts. So I escaped. Tom Arnold picked me up and we went to Le Dome and had tons of desserts.
author: Chris Farley

quote: When I got outta school, I didn't know what I was gonna do with my life. I knew I didn't have much in the grades department, and so I was very fearful. A whole lot of fear.
author: Chris Farley

quote: I went down to Chicago to try to go into a place called Second City. I auditioned for that and got in pretty quickly, but I couldn't stop partying. They gave me a warning: 'If you do it again, we're gonna kick you off the main stage.'
author: Chris Farley

quote: I went and worked for my dad after school. I'd show up late and stuff like that.
author: Chris Farley

quote: I was a common man, and I will always remain a common man. No amount of stardom will ever consume my soul. Money comes, money goes. Fame comes, fame goes. I believe every human being is a celebrity in their own right.
author: A. R. Rahman

quote: Success comes to those who dedicate everything to their passion in life. To be successful, it is also very important to be humble and never let fame or money travel to your head.
author: A. R. Rahman

quote: Your inner voice is the voice of divinity. To hear it, we need to be in solitude, even in crowded places.
author: A. R. Rahman

quote: When you do something with a lot of honesty, appetite and commitment, the input reflects in the output.
author: A. R. Rahman

quote: I believe that whatever comes at a particular time is a blessing from God.
author: A. R. Rahman

quote: I have too many responsibilities and principles. There's no time for 'guilty' pleasures.
author: A. R. Rahman

quote: I feel blessed and humbled that people have loved my music. Nothing would be possible without their acceptance.
author: A. R. Rahman

quote: Each one of us has our own evolution of life, and each one of us goes through different tests which are unique and challenging. But certain things are common. And we do learn things from each other's experience. On a spiritual journey, we all have the same destination.
author: A. R. Rahman

quote: Beautiful film music can be made relevant to any period.
author: A. R. Rahman

quote: I don't want to expose my personal life. It's best that people know me for my work. My family doesn't want to be surrounded by cameras. We want to live like any other family.
author: A. R. Rahman

quote: So long as you do it truthfully, music is not to be judged.
author: A. R. Rahman

quote: I'm a Sufi Muslim, I would say. I believe in using the medium to create a good vibration because art is so important to society. Some projects I don't do because I feel that it's going to create a bad vibe. I don't do propaganda films that are anti another religion, anti-Muslim or anti-Hindu.
author: A. R. Rahman

quote: I grew up on Bach and Beethoven, and now I'm listening to more modern composers who I can't even name. But since I'm constantly doing music, it's difficult to have that quality time to listen to music and do classical stuff.
author: A. R. Rahman

quote: It's like driving your car. If you drive too fast on the highway, you will topple, so you better maintain your speed. Life is similar to that, and that's the way you have to control your head.
author: A. R. Rahman

quote: For me, there is no day or night for music. I often work through the night - without phone calls disturbing me.
author: A. R. Rahman

quote: Comedy is a universal language. I grew up watching Nagesh, Surilirajan, Thenga Srinivasan and S.V. Shekhar's comedies. And, of course, Charlie Chaplin! These artists are so blessed: they can make other people happy.
author: A. R. Rahman

quote: The institution of marriage works better when there's a spiritual connection. If you're marrying just for the sake of the woman, then you may lose interest in each other very soon. When we marry in the interest of the Holy Spirit with the intention of serving God and humanity, then it gives a much larger perspective.
author: A. R. Rahman

quote: Sometimes, a remix is good because it reaches a whole new generation. But when it gets too much, it's irritating. Also, the original composer needs to be credited properly.
author: A. R. Rahman

quote: I joined the Madras Christian College but dropped out after three months. Telugu music director Ramesh Naidu asked me to assist him, and I did so for over a year. I did think of rejoining college, but by then, I was discovering the musician in me. I worked with Illaya Raja and Raj Koti and soon shifted to commercials. This led to movie offers.
author: A. R. Rahman

quote: The idea of music is to liberate the listener and lead him to a frame where he feels he is elevated.
author: A. R. Rahman

quote: Wisdom comes from within. Knowledge is acquired and can sometimes put a screen on your wisdom.
author: A. R. Rahman

quote: I divide criticism into two categories - one coming from those who understand music, who are worthy of being critical because they are knowledgeable about what they are saying; and then there is another category of people who would criticise you anyway, whether your work is good or bad.
author: A. R. Rahman

quote: While my mother wanted me to be a musician, I wanted to become an electronic engineer.
author: A. R. Rahman

quote: Every time I sit for a song, I feel I am finished. It's like a beggar sitting waiting for God to fill your bowl with the right thought. In every song, I ask help from Him. Everybody around is so good, so to create music that will connect with so many people is not humanly possible without inspiration.
author: A. R. Rahman

quote: I think I can get away, sometimes, with walking in the streets and not getting noticed. I like that. I want my work to get noticed, not me. And it's slowly getting there, which is good.
author: A. R. Rahman

quote: I am a friend when I need to be a friend, a father when I need to be a father, a musician when music calls. I switch roles accordingly.
author: A. R. Rahman

quote: Bollywood music is definitely a big part of Indian music and can be a great way to introduce people to the sound. But I hope to continue to incorporate other types of Indian music into my work.
author: A. R. Rahman

quote: After a point of time, when you get success and fame, money and everything, the purpose of life has to be redefined. For me, I think that purpose is to build bridges. Artists can do that very easily, more than politicians.
author: A. R. Rahman

quote: Music is the only passion I shamelessly indulge in. However, for recreation I enjoy watching movies. 'Wizard of Oz' was the first film I ever saw, followed by the 'Bond' movies. I also watch a lot of World cinema through DVDs mostly brought by one of my best friends who's now based in Toronto.
author: A. R. Rahman

quote: I follow a simple formula when I compose. I ask myself, 'What would the audience want to hear?' and 'Why would they buy my CDs?' And the process of answering these questions through music follows. Sometimes, it works. Sometimes, it backfires.
author: A. R. Rahman

quote: Compared with other Indian film composers, I only write about six movies a year. Others write up to 60.
author: A. R. Rahman

quote: A musician is a professional, whether he or she is successful or not. The profession itself must be regarded as a stable job.
author: A. R. Rahman

quote: My mother's belief in spiritual healers grew stronger after our family went through a rough patch following my father's death. Sufi saint Karimullah Shah Kadri changed our lives, and all of us converted to Sufism. But it wasn't an instantaneous decision - it took us 10 years to convert. The change in religion was like washing away the past.
author: A. R. Rahman

quote: I love great lyrics, and I love the way it could shape a tune into a very unpredictable one, and I also like taking a great melody and putting lyrics into it.
author: A. R. Rahman

quote: I want young Indian composers to be able to do more than just film music. I want to give them the skills that will enable them to create their own palette of sounds instead of having to write formulaic music. It doesn't matter if they become sound engineers, producers, composers or performers - I want them to be as imaginative as they like.
author: A. R. Rahman

quote: I'm continuing to learn more about music - it's an ocean, and you can never really say that you know everything. I'm grateful that I'm still living and making music among the greats.
author: A. R. Rahman

quote: If there is no criticism, you become lazy. But it should be constructive, and it should be the truth. If it's biased and there's no truth in it, then I don't care about it. If it's true, it helps me grow.
author: A. R. Rahman

quote: If you respect a language and culture, it shows in your work.
author: A. R. Rahman

quote: When I travel with my kids abroad, I am not myself, but I'm more a father who wants to protect them. Sometimes, I am even aggressive about certain things and get surprised seeing myself like that: for instance, when people want to take pictures of them. I am fine if they want to take my pictures, but they are not public property.
author: A. R. Rahman

quote: I like to see a film and then start scoring it in my mind while doing something unrelated. You just grasp a film and start working, and something unpredictable comes out from a third element. The mind, the more active it is, the more productive it is.
author: A. R. Rahman

quote: I basically love classical music. I love a lot of musicians playing together and the whole culture of that, whether it's Indian or it's Western.
author: A. R. Rahman

quote: The demand in India is to have a hit, which becomes a promotion for the movie and makes people come to the theater. You have five songs and different promotions based on those. But when I do Western films, the need for originality is greater. Then I become very conscious about the writing.
author: A. R. Rahman

quote: My mother insisted that I pursue music. I rented out my father's musical equipment and earned some money. As a child, I wasn't sure about a career goal, but I was always fascinated by electronic gadgets, specially musical equipment.
author: A. R. Rahman

quote: I usually work on a film soundtrack for two years, turning in a song every few months, and that keeps my creative energy high, because I'm constantly rotating projects. The trick is to make sure I don't work too hard and get exhausted.
author: A. R. Rahman

quote: I am the kind of person who does not like to carry baggage. In fact, I don't go back and listen to my own music. I believe in closing chapters and moving forward. That's what gives me peace.
author: A. R. Rahman

quote: Some things are very low profile, but if they excite me creatively, I accept them. Sometimes there are high-profile projects, and you have to do it. We all have human limitations. It is a painful decision to turn things down. Even accepting 'Slumdog Millionaire' was a decision that I had to sacrifice another project.
author: A. R. Rahman

quote: A good film demands its own score, and if you are a musician, your conscience will never allow you to do something mediocre for a good film.
author: A. R. Rahman

quote: The more I compose, the more I know that I don't know it all. I think it's a good way to start. If you think you know it all, the work becomes a repetition of what you've already done. I try to make sure that I don't repeat my music.
author: A. R. Rahman

quote: My kids miss me when I'm away, but I don't mind living out of a suitcase. The U.K., U.S., France, Germany, Iraq... it's such a thrill meeting people of different cultures, learning about and from them. It's changed my perception about life, humanity and spirituality.
author: A. R. Rahman

quote: I was famous from the age of 13, and after a while you become immune to it - in a good way. You look at positives and what you can do with it.
author: A. R. Rahman

quote: My music is mostly for the music. And it gives the liberty to do anything which I want. And nobody limits me to one genre of music. But I learn from life and I try to give back to life, in a way, whether it's the thought of the song or whether it's the approach to the arrangement or anything.
author: A. R. Rahman

quote: It's true that I love to connect with my fans on the social networking sites, but I try not to go overboard, ever. I just give people a peek into my mind space, but never bombard them with my tweets.
author: A. R. Rahman

quote: I think music, in my opinion, is not about motivation in the way it's - it's not a running base. It's art. And my whole philosophy of music is different. It's almost like cooking and serving to people, seeing them smile and enjoying the food, really.
author: A. R. Rahman

quote: I compose music for films, and by the grace of God, I've got a few awards. That's it.
author: A. R. Rahman

quote: The more dollars the studio producers put in, the less freedom we have. If the budget hits $100m, they get scared - they'll take the existing score of a successful movie and expect composers to copy it, like wallpaper. The biggest challenge for any composer in Hollywood is to be as creative as possible within those boundaries.
author: A. R. Rahman

quote: Labour was the first price, the original purchase - money that was paid for all things. It was not by gold or by silver, but by labour, that all wealth of the world was originally purchased.
author: Adam Smith

quote: The real tragedy of the poor is the poverty of their aspirations.
author: Adam Smith

quote: It is not from the benevolence of the butcher, the brewer, or the baker that we expect our dinner, but from their regard to their own interest.
author: Adam Smith

quote: No society can surely be flourishing and happy, of which the far greater part of the members are poor and miserable.
author: Adam Smith

quote: Man is an animal that makes bargains: no other animal does this - no dog exchanges bones with another.
author: Adam Smith

quote: All money is a matter of belief.
author: Adam Smith

quote: As soon as the land of any country has all become private property, the landlords, like all other men, love to reap where they never sowed, and demand a rent even for its natural produce.
author: Adam Smith

quote: Science is the great antidote to the poison of enthusiasm and superstition.
author: Adam Smith

quote: Happiness never lays its finger on its pulse.
author: Adam Smith

quote: Consumption is the sole end and purpose of all production; and the interest of the producer ought to be attended to, only so far as it may be necessary for promoting that of the consumer.
author: Adam Smith

quote: No complaint... is more common than that of a scarcity of money.
author: Adam Smith

quote: To feel much for others and little for ourselves; to restrain our selfishness and exercise our benevolent affections, constitute the perfection of human nature.
author: Adam Smith

quote: Humanity is the virtue of a woman, generosity that of a man.
author: Adam Smith

quote: Defense is superior to opulence.
author: Adam Smith

quote: Little else is requisite to carry a state to the highest degree of opulence from the lowest barbarism but peace, easy taxes, and a tolerable administration of justice: all the rest being brought about by the natural course of things.
author: Adam Smith

quote: What can be added to the happiness of a man who is in health, out of debt, and has a clear conscience?
author: Adam Smith

quote: I have never known much good done by those who affected to trade for the public good.
author: Adam Smith

quote: On the road from the City of Skepticism, I had to pass through the Valley of Ambiguity.
author: Adam Smith

quote: Virtue is more to be feared than vice, because its excesses are not subject to the regulation of conscience.
author: Adam Smith

quote: It is not by augmenting the capital of the country, but by rendering a greater part of that capital active and productive than would otherwise be so, that the most judicious operations of banking can increase the industry of the country.
author: Adam Smith

quote: Labor was the first price, the original purchase - money that was paid for all things.
author: Adam Smith

quote: The propensity to truck, barter and exchange one thing for another is common to all men, and to be found in no other race of animals.
author: Adam Smith

quote: Great ambition, the desire of real superiority, of leading and directing, seems to be altogether peculiar to man, and speech is the great instrument of ambition.
author: Adam Smith

quote: This is one of those cases in which the imagination is baffled by the facts.
author: Adam Smith

quote: With the greater part of rich people, the chief enjoyment of riches consists in the parade of riches.
author: Adam Smith

quote: The real and effectual discipline which is exercised over a workman is that of his customers. It is the fear of losing their employment which restrains his frauds and corrects his negligence.
author: Adam Smith

quote: The theory that can absorb the greatest number of facts, and persist in doing so, generation after generation, through all changes of opinion and detail, is the one that must rule all observation.
author: Adam Smith

quote: Resentment seems to have been given us by nature for a defense, and for a defense only! It is the safeguard of justice and the security of innocence.
author: Adam Smith

quote: Poor David Hume is dying fast, but with more real cheerfulness and good humor and with more real resignation to the necessary course of things, than any whining Christian ever dyed with pretended resignation to the will of God.
author: Adam Smith

quote: Adventure upon all the tickets in the lottery, and you lose for certain; and the greater the number of your tickets the nearer your approach to this certainty.
author: Adam Smith

quote: The only way to deal with an unfree world is to become so absolutely free that your very existence is an act of rebellion.
author: Albert Camus

quote: I would rather live my life as if there is a God and die to find out there isn't, than live as if there isn't and to die to find out that there is.
author: Albert Camus

quote: In the depth of winter I finally learned that there was in me an invincible summer.
author: Albert Camus

quote: You will never be happy if you continue to search for what happiness consists of. You will never live if you are looking for the meaning of life.
author: Albert Camus

quote: A man without ethics is a wild beast loosed upon this world.
author: Albert Camus

quote: Nobody realizes that some people expend tremendous energy merely to be normal.
author: Albert Camus

quote: Men must live and create. Live to the point of tears.
author: Albert Camus

quote: Blessed are the hearts that can bend; they shall never be broken.
author: Albert Camus

quote: Those who lack the courage will always find a philosophy to justify it.
author: Albert Camus

quote: The welfare of the people in particular has always been the alibi of tyrants.
author: Albert Camus

quote: Autumn is a second spring when every leaf is a flower.
author: Albert Camus

quote: Beauty is unbearable, drives us to despair, offering us for a minute the glimpse of an eternity that we should like to stretch out over the whole of time.
author: Albert Camus

quote: Nothing is more despicable than respect based on fear.
author: Albert Camus

quote: Freedom is nothing but a chance to be better.
author: Albert Camus

quote: You cannot create experience. You must undergo it.
author: Albert Camus

quote: The struggle itself towards the heights is enough to fill a man's heart. One must imagine Sisyphus happy.
author: Albert Camus

quote: To be happy we must not be too concerned with others.
author: Albert Camus

quote: A man's work is nothing but this slow trek to rediscover, through the detours of art, those two or three great and simple images in whose presence his heart first opened.
author: Albert Camus

quote: A free press can, of course, be good or bad, but, most certainly without freedom, the press will never be anything but bad.
author: Albert Camus

quote: Without culture, and the relative freedom it implies, society, even when perfect, is but a jungle. This is why any authentic creation is a gift to the future.
author: Albert Camus

quote: Real generosity toward the future lies in giving all to the present.
author: Albert Camus

quote: The need to be right is the sign of a vulgar mind.
author: Albert Camus

quote: He who despairs of the human condition is a coward, but he who has hope for it is a fool.
author: Albert Camus

quote: Man is the only creature that refuses to be what he is.
author: Albert Camus

quote: But what is happiness except the simple harmony between a man and the life he leads?
author: Albert Camus

quote: Integrity has no need of rules.
author: Albert Camus

quote: Basically, at the very bottom of life, which seduces us all, there is only absurdity, and more absurdity. And maybe that's what gives us our joy for living, because the only thing that can defeat absurdity is lucidity.
author: Albert Camus

quote: We always deceive ourselves twice about the people we love - first to their advantage, then to their disadvantage.
author: Albert Camus

quote: Each generation doubtless feels called upon to reform the world. Mine knows that it will not reform it, but its task is perhaps even greater. It consists in preventing the world from destroying itself.
author: Albert Camus

quote: Every act of rebellion expresses a nostalgia for innocence and an appeal to the essence of being.
author: Albert Camus

quote: The absurd is the essential concept and the first truth.
author: Albert Camus

quote: It is necessary to fall in love... if only to provide an alibi for all the random despair you are going to feel anyway.
author: Albert Camus

quote: I know of only one duty, and that is to love.
author: Albert Camus

quote: There is no love of life without despair of life.
author: Albert Camus

quote: We continue to shape our personality all our life. If we knew ourselves perfectly, we should die.
author: Albert Camus

quote: A guilty conscience needs to confess. A work of art is a confession.
author: Albert Camus

quote: For if there is a sin against life, it consists perhaps not so much in despairing of life as in hoping for another life and in eluding the implacable grandeur of this life.
author: Albert Camus

quote: Without work, all life goes rotten. But when work is soulless, life stifles and dies.
author: Albert Camus

quote: The evil that is in the world almost always comes of ignorance, and good intentions may do as much harm as malevolence if they lack understanding.
author: Albert Camus

quote: The only real progress lies in learning to be wrong all alone.
author: Albert Camus

quote: Alas, after a certain age every man is responsible for his face.
author: Albert Camus

quote: Don't wait for the last judgment - it takes place every day.
author: Albert Camus

quote: An intellectual is someone whose mind watches itself.
author: Albert Camus

quote: Truth, like light, blinds. Falsehood, on the contrary, is a beautiful twilight that enhances every object.
author: Albert Camus

quote: As a remedy to life in society I would suggest the big city. Nowadays, it is the only desert within our means.
author: Albert Camus

quote: Charm is a way of getting the answer 'Yes' without asking a clear question.
author: Albert Camus

quote: No cause justifies the deaths of innocent people.
author: Albert Camus

quote: In order to understand the world, one has to turn away from it on occasion.
author: Albert Camus

quote: Friendship often ends in love, but love in friendship - never.
author: Albert Camus

quote: To know oneself, one should assert oneself.
author: Albert Camus

quote: By definition, a government has no conscience. Sometimes it has a policy, but nothing more.
author: Albert Camus

quote: The modern mind is in complete disarray. Knowledge has stretched itself to the point where neither the world nor our intelligence can find any foot-hold. It is a fact that we are suffering from nihilism.
author: Albert Camus

quote: The society based on production is only productive, not creative.
author: Albert Camus

quote: Stupidity has a knack of getting its way.
author: Albert Camus

quote: It is a kind of spiritual snobbery that makes people think they can be happy without money.
author: Albert Camus

quote: What is a rebel? A man who says no: but whose refusal does not imply a renunciation.
author: Albert Camus

quote: All great deeds and all great thoughts have a ridiculous beginning. Great works are often born on a street corner or in a restaurant's revolving door.
author: Albert Camus

quote: I should like to be able to love my country and still love justice.
author: Albert Camus

quote: We get into the habit of living before acquiring the habit of thinking. In that race which daily hastens us towards death, the body maintains its irreparable lead.
author: Albert Camus

quote: In order to exist, man must rebel, but rebellion must respect the limits that it discovers in itself - limits where minds meet, and in meeting, begin to exist.
author: Albert Camus

quote: There is only one corner of the universe you can be certain of improving, and that's your own self.
author: Aldous Huxley

quote: One of the great attractions of patriotism - it fulfills our worst wishes. In the person of our nation we are able, vicariously, to bully and cheat. Bully and cheat, what's more, with a feeling that we are profoundly virtuous.
author: Aldous Huxley

quote: The secret of genius is to carry the spirit of the child into old age, which means never losing your enthusiasm.
author: Aldous Huxley

quote: The propagandist's purpose is to make one set of people forget that certain other sets of people are human.
author: Aldous Huxley

quote: That men do not learn very much from the lessons of history is the most important of all the lessons of history.
author: Aldous Huxley

quote: There are things known and there are things unknown, and in between are the doors of perception.
author: Aldous Huxley

quote: After silence, that which comes nearest to expressing the inexpressible is music.
author: Aldous Huxley

quote: Dream in a pragmatic way.
author: Aldous Huxley

quote: You shall know the truth, and the truth shall make you mad.
author: Aldous Huxley

quote: Experience is not what happens to you; it's what you do with what happens to you.
author: Aldous Huxley

quote: It is a bit embarrassing to have been concerned with the human problem all one's life and find at the end that one has no more to offer by way of advice than 'try to be a little kinder.'
author: Aldous Huxley

quote: Facts do not cease to exist because they are ignored.
author: Aldous Huxley

quote: Maybe this world is another planet's hell.
author: Aldous Huxley

quote: Technological progress has merely provided us with more efficient means for going backwards.
author: Aldous Huxley

quote: To travel is to discover that everyone is wrong about other countries.
author: Aldous Huxley

quote: Beauty is worse than wine, it intoxicates both the holder and beholder.
author: Aldous Huxley

quote: Great is truth, but still greater, from a practical point of view, is silence about truth. By simply not mentioning certain subjects... totalitarian propagandists have influenced opinion much more effectively than they could have by the most eloquent denunciations.
author: Aldous Huxley

quote: The more powerful and original a mind, the more it will incline towards the religion of solitude.
author: Aldous Huxley

quote: An intellectual is a person who's found one thing that's more interesting than sex.
author: Aldous Huxley

quote: The most shocking fact about war is that its victims and its instruments are individual human beings, and that these individual beings are condemned by the monstrous conventions of politics to murder or be murdered in quarrels not their own.
author: Aldous Huxley

quote: Perhaps it's good for one to suffer. Can an artist do anything if he's happy? Would he ever want to do anything? What is art, after all, but a protest against the horrible inclemency of life?
author: Aldous Huxley

quote: Several excuses are always less convincing than one.
author: Aldous Huxley

quote: Most ignorance is vincible ignorance. We don't know because we don't want to know.
author: Aldous Huxley

quote: Experience teaches only the teachable.
author: Aldous Huxley

quote: Most human beings have an almost infinite capacity for taking things for granted.
author: Aldous Huxley

quote: The worst enemy of life, freedom and the common decencies is total anarchy; their second worst enemy is total efficiency.
author: Aldous Huxley

quote: I'm afraid of losing my obscurity. Genuineness only thrives in the dark. Like celery.
author: Aldous Huxley

quote: Cynical realism is the intelligent man's best excuse for doing nothing in an intolerable situation.
author: Aldous Huxley

quote: Every man who knows how to read has it in his power to magnify himself, to multiply the ways in which he exists, to make his life full, significant and interesting.
author: Aldous Huxley

quote: A child-like man is not a man whose development has been arrested; on the contrary, he is a man who has given himself a chance of continuing to develop long after most adults have muffled themselves in the cocoon of middle-aged habit and convention.
author: Aldous Huxley

quote: The most valuable of all education is the ability to make yourself do the thing you have to do, when it has to be done, whether you like it or not.
author: Aldous Huxley

quote: There isn't any formula or method. You learn to love by loving - by paying attention and doing what one thereby discovers has to be done.
author: Aldous Huxley

quote: There's only one corner of the universe you can be certain of improving, and that's your own self.
author: Aldous Huxley

quote: All gods are homemade, and it is we who pull their strings, and so, give them the power to pull ours.
author: Aldous Huxley

quote: Consistency is contrary to nature, contrary to life. The only completely consistent people are dead.
author: Aldous Huxley

quote: To his dog, every man is Napoleon; hence the constant popularity of dogs.
author: Aldous Huxley

quote: Man approaches the unattainable truth through a succession of errors.
author: Aldous Huxley

quote: Science has explained nothing; the more we know the more fantastic the world becomes and the profounder the surrounding darkness.
author: Aldous Huxley

quote: There is no substitute for talent. Industry and all its virtues are of no avail.
author: Aldous Huxley

quote: An unexciting truth may be eclipsed by a thrilling lie.
author: Aldous Huxley

quote: A democracy which makes or even effectively prepares for modern, scientific war must necessarily cease to be democratic. No country can be really well prepared for modern war unless it is governed by a tyrant, at the head of a highly trained and perfectly obedient bureaucracy.
author: Aldous Huxley

quote: My fate cannot be mastered; it can only be collaborated with and thereby, to some extent, directed. Nor am I the captain of my soul; I am only its noisiest passenger.
author: Aldous Huxley

quote: God isn't compatible with machinery and scientific medicine and universal happiness. You must make your choice. Our civilization has chosen machinery and medicine and happiness.
author: Aldous Huxley

quote: My father considered a walk among the mountains as the equivalent of churchgoing.
author: Aldous Huxley

quote: Hell isn't merely paved with good intentions; it's walled and roofed with them. Yes, and furnished too.
author: Aldous Huxley

quote: Chastity - the most unnatural of all the sexual perversions.
author: Aldous Huxley

quote: Everyone who wants to do good to the human race always ends in universal bullying.
author: Aldous Huxley

quote: Speed provides the one genuinely modern pleasure.
author: Aldous Huxley

quote: Man is an intelligence in servitude to his organs.
author: Aldous Huxley

quote: People intoxicate themselves with work so they won't see how they really are.
author: Aldous Huxley

quote: A belief in hell and the knowledge that every ambition is doomed to frustration at the hands of a skeleton have never prevented the majority of human beings from behaving as though death were no more than an unfounded rumor.
author: Aldous Huxley

quote: Sons have always a rebellious wish to be disillusioned by that which charmed their fathers.
author: Aldous Huxley

quote: Idealism is the noble toga that political gentlemen drape over their will to power.
author: Aldous Huxley

quote: That all men are equal is a proposition to which, at ordinary times, no sane human being has ever given his assent.
author: Aldous Huxley

quote: Your true traveller finds boredom rather agreeable than painful. It is the symbol of his liberty - his excessive freedom. He accepts his boredom, when it comes, not merely philosophically, but almost with pleasure.
author: Aldous Huxley

quote: Proverbs are always platitudes until you have personally experienced the truth of them.
author: Aldous Huxley

quote: Men do not learn much from the lessons of history and that is the most important of all the lessons of history.
author: Aldous Huxley

quote: If human beings were shown what they're really like, they'd either kill one another as vermin, or hang themselves.
author: Aldous Huxley

quote: The charm of history and its enigmatic lesson consist in the fact that, from age to age, nothing changes and yet everything is completely different.
author: Aldous Huxley

quote: A fanatic is a man who consciously over compensates a secret doubt.
author: Aldous Huxley

quote: To err is human; to forgive, divine.
author: Alexander Pope

quote: Hope springs eternal in the human breast: Man never is, but always to be blest.
author: Alexander Pope

quote: Be not the first by whom the new are tried, Nor yet the last to lay the old aside.
author: Alexander Pope

quote: For Forms of Government let fools contest; whatever is best administered is best.
author: Alexander Pope

quote: Act well your part, there all the honour lies.
author: Alexander Pope

quote: Honor and shame from no condition rise. Act well your part: there all the honor lies.
author: Alexander Pope

quote: Nature and nature's laws lay hid in the night. God said, Let Newton be! and all was light!
author: Alexander Pope

quote: Men must be taught as if you taught them not, and things unknown proposed as things forgot.
author: Alexander Pope

quote: 'Tis education forms the common mind; just as the twig is bent the tree's inclined.
author: Alexander Pope

quote: Charms strike the sight, but merit wins the soul.
author: Alexander Pope

quote: No one should be ashamed to admit he is wrong, which is but saying, in other words, that he is wiser today than he was yesterday.
author: Alexander Pope

quote: For modes of faith let graceless zealots fight, His can't be wrong whose life is in the right.
author: Alexander Pope

quote: True ease in writing comes from art, not chance, as those move easiest who have learn'd to dance.
author: Alexander Pope

quote: Trust not yourself, but your defects to know, make use of every friend and every foe.
author: Alexander Pope

quote: Teach me to feel another's woe, to hide the fault I see, that mercy I to others show, that mercy show to me.
author: Alexander Pope

quote: Happy the man whose wish and care a few paternal acres bound, content to breathe his native air in his own ground.
author: Alexander Pope

quote: The proper study of Mankind is Man.
author: Alexander Pope

quote: On wrongs swift vengeance waits.
author: Alexander Pope

quote: To be angry is to revenge the faults of others on ourselves.
author: Alexander Pope

quote: The most positive men are the most credulous.
author: Alexander Pope

quote: Fools rush in where angels fear to tread.
author: Alexander Pope

quote: The hungry judges soon the sentence sign, and wretches hang that jurymen may dine.
author: Alexander Pope

quote: Beauties in vain their pretty eyes may roll; charms strike the sight, but merit wins the soul.
author: Alexander Pope

quote: The bookful blockhead, ignorantly read, With loads of learned lumber in his head.
author: Alexander Pope

quote: Some people will never learn anything, for this reason, because they understand everything too soon.
author: Alexander Pope

quote: A little learning is a dangerous thing; Drink deep, or taste not the Pierian spring.
author: Alexander Pope

quote: Praise undeserved, is satire in disguise.
author: Alexander Pope

quote: Lo! The poor Indian, whose untutored mind sees God in clouds, or hears him in the wind.
author: Alexander Pope

quote: Party-spirit at best is but the madness of many for the gain of a few.
author: Alexander Pope

quote: The greatest magnifying glasses in the world are a man's own eyes when they look upon his own person.
author: Alexander Pope

quote: Woman's at best a contradiction still.
author: Alexander Pope

quote: Blessed is the man who expects nothing, for he shall never be disappointed was the ninth beatitude.
author: Alexander Pope

quote: An honest man's the noblest work of God.
author: Alexander Pope

quote: And, after all, what is a lie? 'Tis but the truth in a masquerade.
author: Alexander Pope

quote: All are but parts of one stupendous whole, Whose body Nature is, and God the soul.
author: Alexander Pope

quote: On life's vast ocean diversely we sail. Reasons the card, but passion the gale.
author: Alexander Pope

quote: Who shall decide when doctors disagree, And soundest casuists doubt, like you and me?
author: Alexander Pope

quote: Whoever thinks a faultless piece to see, Thinks what ne'er was, nor is, nor e'er shall be.
author: Alexander Pope

quote: And die of nothing but a rage to live.
author: Alexander Pope

quote: The ruling passion, be it what it will. The ruling passion conquers reason still.
author: Alexander Pope

quote: A brain of feathers, and a heart of lead.
author: Alexander Pope

quote: The vulgar boil, the learned roast, an egg.
author: Alexander Pope

quote: One science only will one genius fit; so vast is art, so narrow human wit.
author: Alexander Pope

quote: Is pride, the never-failing vice of fools.
author: Alexander Pope

quote: The world forgetting, by the world forgot.
author: Alexander Pope

quote: Like Cato, give his little senate laws, and sit attentive to his own applause.
author: Alexander Pope
