quote: Wise men speak because they have something to say; Fools because they have to say something.
author: Unknown

quote: Insanity: doing the same thing over and over again and expecting different results.
author: Unknown

quote: The past cannot be changed. The future is yet in your power.
author: Unknown

quote: We are all born ignorant, but one must work hard to remain stupid.
author: Unknown

quote: Better to remain silent and be thought a fool than to speak out and remove all doubt.
author: Unknown

quote: Kindness is the language which the deaf can hear and the blind can see.
author: Unknown

quote: Don't walk behind me; I may not lead. Don't walk in front of me; I may not follow. Just walk beside me and be my friend.
author: Unknown

quote: In a time of universal deceit - telling the truth is a revolutionary act.
author: Unknown

quote: It has become appallingly obvious that our technology has exceeded our humanity.
author: Unknown

quote: Everybody wants to go to heaven, but nobody wants to die.
author: Unknown

quote: Turn your face to the sun and the shadows fall behind you.
author: Unknown

quote: Choose a job you love, and you will never have to work a day in your life.
author: Unknown

quote: The difference between stupidity and genius is that genius has its limits.
author: Unknown

quote: You have to learn the rules of the game. And then you have to play better than anyone else.
author: Unknown

quote: A picture is worth a thousand words.
author: Unknown

quote: The hottest place in Hell is reserved for those who remain neutral in times of great moral conflict.
author: Unknown

quote: When a father gives to his son, both laugh; when a son gives to his father, both cry.
author: Unknown

quote: If the facts don't fit the theory, change the facts.
author: Unknown

quote: Unless you try to do something beyond what you have already mastered, you will never grow.
author: Unknown

quote: You should examine yourself daily. If you find faults, you should correct them. When you find none, you should try even harder.
author: Unknown

quote: A man who stands for nothing will fall for anything.
author: Unknown

quote: The way is not in the sky. The way is in the heart.
author: Unknown

quote: Life is tough, but it's tougher if you're stupid.
author: Unknown

quote: However beautiful the strategy, you should occasionally look at the results.
author: Unknown

quote: People who say it cannot be done should not interrupt those who are doing it.
author: Unknown

quote: A true conservationist is a man who knows that the world is not given by his fathers, but borrowed from his children.
author: Unknown

quote: Things may come to those who wait, but only the things left by those who hustle.
author: Unknown

quote: The secret to creativity is knowing how to hide your sources.
author: Unknown

quote: Promise me you'll always remember: You're braver than you believe, and stronger than you seem, and smarter than you think.
author: Unknown

quote: If you tell a big enough lie and tell it frequently enough, it will be believed.
author: Unknown

quote: There has to be evil so that good can prove its purity above it.
author: Unknown

quote: I freed a thousand slaves I could have freed a thousand more if only they knew they were slaves.
author: Unknown

quote: Time spent with cats is never wasted.
author: Unknown

quote: Preach the Gospel at all times and when necessary use words.
author: Unknown

quote: True change takes place in the imagination.
author: Unknown

quote: Never ascribe to malice that which is adequately explained by incompetence.
author: Unknown

quote: Anytime you see a turtle up on top of a fence post, you know he had some help.
author: Unknown

quote: An insincere and evil friend is more to be feared than a wild beast; a wild beast may wound your body, but an evil friend will wound your mind.
author: Unknown

quote: All warfare is based on deception.
author: Unknown

quote: I never drink water because of the disgusting things that fish do in it.
author: Unknown

quote: There is no such thing as a good tax.
author: Unknown

quote: Large skepticism leads to large understanding. Small skepticism leads to small understanding. No skepticism leads to no understanding.
author: Unknown

quote: Less is more, unless you're Al Gore.
author: Unknown

quote: If you bring forth what is within you, what you bring forth will save you. If you do not bring forth what is within you, what you do not bring forth will destroy you.
author: Unknown

quote: If you're not first, you're last.
author: Unknown

quote: It is a damn poor mind indeed which can't think of at least two ways to spell any word.
author: Unknown

quote: Women are like teabags. We don't know our true strength until we are in hot water!
author: Unknown

quote: Character is the result of a system of stereotyped principles.
author: Unknown

quote: If you done it, it ain't bragging.
author: Unknown

quote: It's a damn poor mind that can only think of one way to spell a word.
author: Unknown

quote: He was a wise man who invented beer.
author: Unknown

quote: I wish I could write as mysterious as a cat.
author: Unknown

quote: Life is the flower for which love is the honey.
author: Victor Hugo

quote: To love beauty is to see light.
author: Victor Hugo

quote: The greatest happiness of life is the conviction that we are loved; loved for ourselves, or rather, loved in spite of ourselves.
author: Victor Hugo

quote: Laughter is the sun that drives winter from the human face.
author: Victor Hugo

quote: He who opens a school door, closes a prison.
author: Victor Hugo

quote: Forty is the old age of youth; fifty the youth of old age.
author: Victor Hugo

quote: Perseverance, secret of all triumphs.
author: Victor Hugo

quote: Be like the bird who, pausing in her flight awhile on boughs too slight, feels them give way beneath her, and yet sings, knowing she hath wings.
author: Victor Hugo

quote: Music expresses that which cannot be said and on which it is impossible to be silent.
author: Victor Hugo

quote: A mother's arms are made of tenderness and children sleep soundly in them.
author: Victor Hugo

quote: When dictatorship is a fact, revolution becomes a right.
author: Victor Hugo

quote: Virtue has a veil, vice a mask.
author: Victor Hugo

quote: Concision in style, precision in thought, decision in life.
author: Victor Hugo

quote: To learn to read is to light a fire; every syllable that is spelled out is a spark.
author: Victor Hugo

quote: Adversity makes men, and prosperity makes monsters.
author: Victor Hugo

quote: There is nothing like a dream to create the future.
author: Victor Hugo

quote: To love another person is to see the face of God.
author: Victor Hugo

quote: Be as a bird perched on a frail branch that she feels bending beneath her, still she sings away all the same, knowing she has wings.
author: Victor Hugo

quote: The wicked envy and hate; it is their way of admiring.
author: Victor Hugo

quote: When a woman is talking to you, listen to what she says with her eyes.
author: Victor Hugo

quote: A compliment is something like a kiss through a veil.
author: Victor Hugo

quote: All the forces in the world are not so powerful as an idea whose time has come.
author: Victor Hugo

quote: What is history? An echo of the past in the future; a reflex from the future on the past.
author: Victor Hugo

quote: An intelligent hell would be better than a stupid paradise.
author: Victor Hugo

quote: The soul has illusions as the bird has wings: it is supported by them.
author: Victor Hugo

quote: Change your opinions, keep to your principles; change your leaves, keep intact your roots.
author: Victor Hugo

quote: An invasion of armies can be resisted, but not an idea whose time has come.
author: Victor Hugo

quote: When grace is joined with wrinkles, it is adorable. There is an unspeakable dawn in happy old age.
author: Victor Hugo

quote: Conscience is God present in man.
author: Victor Hugo

quote: Initiative is doing the right thing without being told.
author: Victor Hugo

quote: Short as life is, we make it still shorter by the careless waste of time.
author: Victor Hugo

quote: Have courage for the great sorrows of life and patience for the small ones; and when you have laboriously accomplished your daily task, go to sleep in peace.
author: Victor Hugo

quote: I met in the street a very poor young man who was in love. His hat was old, his coat worn, his cloak was out at the elbows, the water passed through his shoes, - and the stars through his soul.
author: Victor Hugo

quote: Peace is the virtue of civilization. War is its crime.
author: Victor Hugo

quote: Freedom in art, freedom in society, this is the double goal towards which all consistent and logical minds must strive.
author: Victor Hugo

quote: There are thoughts which are prayers. There are moments when, whatever the posture of the body, the soul is on its knees.
author: Victor Hugo

quote: The supreme happiness of life is the conviction that we are loved; loved for ourselves, or rather in spite of ourselves.
author: Victor Hugo

quote: As the purse is emptied, the heart is filled.
author: Victor Hugo

quote: It is nothing to die. It is frightful not to live.
author: Victor Hugo

quote: Nations, like stars, are entitled to eclipse. All is well, provided the light returns and the eclipse does not become endless night. Dawn and resurrection are synonymous. The reappearance of the light is the same as the survival of the soul.
author: Victor Hugo

quote: How did it happen that their lips came together? How does it happen that birds sing, that snow melts, that the rose unfolds, that the dawn whitens behind the stark shapes of trees on the quivering summit of the hill? A kiss, and all was said.
author: Victor Hugo

quote: Strong and bitter words indicate a weak cause.
author: Victor Hugo

quote: Great perils have this beauty, that they bring to light the fraternity of strangers.
author: Victor Hugo

quote: He, who every morning plans the transactions of the day, and follows that plan, carries a thread that will guide him through a labyrinth of the most busy life.
author: Victor Hugo

quote: Fashions have done more harm than revolutions.
author: Victor Hugo

quote: Common sense is in spite of, not as the result of education.
author: Victor Hugo

quote: Hope is the word which God has written on the brow of every man.
author: Victor Hugo

quote: Son, brother, father, lover, friend. There is room in the heart for all the affections, as there is room in heaven for all the stars.
author: Victor Hugo

quote: Our life dreams the Utopia. Our death achieves the Ideal.
author: Victor Hugo

quote: There is one spectacle grander than the sea, that is the sky; there is one spectacle grander than the sky, that is the interior of the soul.
author: Victor Hugo

quote: Life's greatest happiness is to be convinced we are loved.
author: Victor Hugo

quote: Love is a portion of the soul itself, and it is of the same nature as the celestial breathing of the atmosphere of paradise.
author: Victor Hugo

quote: A faith is a necessity to a man. Woe to him who believes in nothing.
author: Victor Hugo

quote: The learned man knows that he is ignorant.
author: Victor Hugo

quote: There is one thing stronger than all the armies in the world, and that is an idea whose time as come.
author: Victor Hugo

quote: We see past time in a telescope and present time in a microscope. Hence the apparent enormities of the present.
author: Victor Hugo

quote: Intelligence is the wife, imagination is the mistress, memory is the servant.
author: Victor Hugo

quote: One is not idle because one is absorbed. There is both visible and invisible labor. To contemplate is to toil, to think is to do. The crossed arms work, the clasped hands act. The eyes upturned to Heaven are an act of creation.
author: Victor Hugo

quote: Each man should frame life so that at some future hour fact and his dreaming meet.
author: Victor Hugo

quote: The wise man does not grow old, but ripens.
author: Victor Hugo

quote: Self-belief and hard work will always earn you success.
author: Virat Kohli

quote: I like to be myself, and I don't pretend. For instance, I don't dress up for occasions; I am what I am.
author: Virat Kohli

quote: Whatever you want to do, do with full passion and work really hard towards it. Don't look anywhere else. There will be a few distractions, but if you can be true to yourself, you will be successful for sure.
author: Virat Kohli

quote: I do believe in God. But you won't find me visiting temples every now and then. I believe in self-realization. Peace of mind matters a lot to me. What's the point in doing something just for the sake of it? I'd rather do something I like doing as long as I'm being true to myself.
author: Virat Kohli

quote: No cricket team in the world depends on one or two players. The team always plays to win.
author: Virat Kohli

quote: The bat is not a toy, it's a weapon. It gives me everything in life, which helps me to do everything on the field.
author: Virat Kohli

quote: I love playing under pressure. In fact, if there's no pressure, then I'm not in the perfect zone.
author: Virat Kohli

quote: Pretension is a poor joke that you play on yourself. Snap out of it. Recognise your strengths, work on your weaknesses. Real achievement is liking what you see in the mirror every morning.
author: Virat Kohli

quote: I delayed my father's funeral because of cricket.
author: Virat Kohli

quote: On the field, aggression can sometimes be a positive emotion. It boosts performance and can lift your game. But over the years, I have learnt that restrained aggression is a better animal. That way, you will conserve your energy and won't spend yourself quickly.
author: Virat Kohli

quote: Probably because I'm from a middle class family, I have that nature in me that I don't get too excited with big things.
author: Virat Kohli

quote: I always dreamt of holding the bat and winning games for India. That was my inspiration to take up cricket.
author: Virat Kohli

quote: I support Real Madrid. I'm a big fan of Cristiano Ronaldo.
author: Virat Kohli

quote: A fit body gives you confidence. And there's nothing more impressive than a great attitude, which you can wear on your sleeve. But you'll have to remember the difference between being rude and being confident.
author: Virat Kohli

quote: Delhi means everything to me. This city has given me everything, and I love it.
author: Virat Kohli

quote: Nothing extraordinary happens to a cricketer if you time his career - which is very short.
author: Virat Kohli

quote: Irrespective of whether you have talent or not, one has to work hard. Just being talented doesn't mean anything; you can end up wasting it before you realize.
author: Virat Kohli

quote: Everyone loves a win in India. No one wants to lose a match. It is the cricketer who absorbs all the pressure.
author: Virat Kohli

quote: The people you choose to have around you make all the difference. My family and close friends keep me grounded. You have to have a mind of your own and a strong head on your shoulders. Cricket is the most important thing to me, so the rest of it pales in comparison.
author: Virat Kohli

quote: People from North India are generally known to be aggressive and emotional.
author: Virat Kohli

quote: Becoming an inspiration for kids is great. I want to inspire them to do whatever they want to.
author: Virat Kohli

quote: In cricket, my superhero is Sachin Tendulkar. He has always been my hero and will continue to remain so. Apart from him and outside cricket, my mother has remained my inspiration. Whatever difficult time I had faced, she was always there for me. She has given me all the strength. She maintained her composure and supported me in tough times.
author: Virat Kohli

quote: My shopping habits... I am not very brand-conscious about clothes. I buy whatever looks good on me. Likewise, I don't just shop only in malls or high-end stores.
author: Virat Kohli

quote: I feel only my friends and family need to know what is happening in my personal life.
author: Virat Kohli

quote: I want to be relaxed in my personal life. I really don't like to be hassled.
author: Virat Kohli

quote: I love driving my car on any highway.
author: Virat Kohli

quote: The more centuries that I am able to score, the happier I will be.
author: Virat Kohli

quote: I'm not someone who sits at home and doesn't like to go out, doesn't like to watch movies. I like to live my life.
author: Virat Kohli

quote: In T20, you don't have time to get distracted - it's so quick, you have to run around in the field, and while batting, you don't actually think about anything else.
author: Virat Kohli

quote: I like to always lead from the front and set an example for whoever is playing with me or around me. I like taking responsibilities. That is my natural thing.
author: Virat Kohli

quote: I believe that fairness creams protect the skin against the harsh effects of the sun.
author: Virat Kohli

quote: I'm a big fan of Aamir Khan... Among actresses, I like Aishwarya Rai.
author: Virat Kohli

quote: I do not abuse players. I talk to myself; I abuse myself. It's my way of letting off steam. I do it after every century; I do not do it always. I keep telling myself: 'Improve, improve from the previous match, the previous shot. You can do it.'
author: Virat Kohli

quote: Good Punjabi music before a match pumps me up. It gives me a kick.
author: Virat Kohli

quote: My main focus is always to do well on the field for the Indian cricket team. When people say good things about me off the field, I am more than happy to accept them.
author: Virat Kohli

quote: The joy of doing well as a batsman for your country is much more than that little joy of going for a party and enjoying music. It is a completely different high, and I get high by performances. That's what I enjoy now.
author: Virat Kohli

quote: I love trying out different cuisines. In Delhi, I love Megu at the Leela, and TK's at the Hyatt. I also enjoy Khan Chacha's rolls. In Mumbai, it's Royal China and Shiro. And in Bangalore, I like the food at Bricklane.
author: Virat Kohli

quote: I'm not a nerd, don't plan to be a nerd and read books - which I can't do at all.
author: Virat Kohli

quote: In the game of cricket, a hero is a person who respects the game and does not corrupt the game. The one who doesn't or corrupts the game, they are the villain. They should be punished, and they have been punished in the past.
author: Virat Kohli

quote: I feel really blessed when people start comparing me with Sachin, but I keep myself focused on my performance and not on such comparisons. I literally worship him, so I don't see too much in this comparison. No cricketer has been able to score one hundred centuries like Sachin.
author: Virat Kohli

quote: You have to stay fresh and blank in your mind when you go out to bat. You complicate things, and you're gone.
author: Virat Kohli

quote: I don't believe in signing anything and everything that comes my way. I leave it to my agency to help narrow them down for me, but I do research it myself before signing. The image of the brand and its ambassadors go hand in hand.
author: Virat Kohli

quote: My priority is cricket. Everything that I get apart from it is a result of the effort on the field. Everything else follows. I am pretty aware of my priorities, and I don't really focus on things that are not as important to me as cricket.
author: Virat Kohli

quote: Music, for me, is vital. Punjabi, Bollywood, Sufi, RnB... I listen to it all. When I'm not listening to music, you will find me chatting with friends. Off the field, I just let my instincts take over. I certainly don't think about batting, or which bowlers I'm going to face.
author: Virat Kohli

quote: During my school days, I was doing a play, and my costume fell on the stage. I really wish it didn't happen.
author: Virat Kohli

quote: I have made a few mistakes early on that I admit myself, and there have been times when I have gone over the top and done things that you shouldn't do in international cricket, but that's how you learn.
author: Virat Kohli

quote: I love soccer, love tennis... Roger Federer has been a favourite for a long, long time. The kind of consistency he has shown, 16 Grand Slam titles... The way he handles himself in pressure situations is admirable... He is so calm... In soccer, I'm a huge fan of Barcelona... I like watching Cristiano Ronaldo, Lionel Messi and David Villa.
author: Virat Kohli

quote: I want my wardrobe to be full of good clothes, so that when I'm deciding what to wear, I don't run out of options. I love shopping!
author: Virat Kohli

quote: As a kid, even I knew everything about my favourite cricketers. I used to know everything possible. Now I see kids knowing about me. It feels good.
author: Virat Kohli

quote: Whatever I am, it's natural... I don't have to pretend to be aggressive, don't have to show the opposition that I am on the field. Being aggressive comes naturally to me, helps me perform.
author: Virat Kohli

quote: I love wearing whatever is comfortable, and that could be something which was in trend years ago. So, I don't follow fashion.
author: Virat Kohli

quote: I want to elongate my cricketing career as a consistent player. I have personal goals I would like to achieve someday.
author: Virat Kohli

quote: Unless someone wants to look funny, I'll not recommend anyone to copy my bowling action. But on a serious note, with the confidence that I have got from the amount of runs I have been scoring, when I'm thrown the ball to bowl, I am pretty sure of what I have to do. I may not be the most attractive to watch while bowling, but I can be effective.
author: Virat Kohli

quote: Never at any point did I feel like missing a training session. I was very keen on improving as a cricketer and as an international player.
author: Virat Kohli

quote: I've had a fan who made a painting of my face with her fingers. I have put it up in my room. It was sweet and very different.
author: Virat Kohli

quote: I love tattoos. And mine symbolise who I really am. I have a Samurai on my left arm. At a subconscious level, I connect to this warrior and model myself on his discipline, skills and honour. There is also a tribal tattoo and a Chinese symbol of faith. I have seen a lot of people getting tattoos just because it's a trend.
author: Virat Kohli

quote: I've never fought with anyone. A lot of people talk to me, and they're like, 'Oh, you would have been fighting all the time when you were younger,' but I'm like, 'I never fought with anyone because I always knew that if I hurt myself, I might lose important time in my cricket career,' so I never got into any fight, ever in my life.
author: Virat Kohli

quote: My focus had always been the on-side. My coach wanted me to work on the offside strokes since he was convinced of my ability and timing on the leg side. I worked hard and firmed up my defensive technique. I am happy getting runs all around the wicket now, and getting a lot of boundaries. No one calls me a 'leggie batsman' anymore.
author: Virat Kohli

quote: Endorsements are a reward for good performance on the field, and the commitments made after signing them need to be done.
author: Virat Kohli

quote: I get really motivated when I put on the India jersey. It is a responsibility, so I want to perform in the best way I can.
author: Virat Kohli

quote: One cannot think well, love well, sleep well, if one has not dined well.
author: Virginia Woolf

quote: If you do not tell the truth about yourself you cannot tell it about other people.
author: Virginia Woolf

quote: You cannot find peace by avoiding life.
author: Virginia Woolf

quote: My own brain is to me the most unaccountable of machinery - always buzzing, humming, soaring roaring diving, and then buried in mud. And why? What's this passion for?
author: Virginia Woolf

quote: Some people go to priests; others to poetry; I to my friends.
author: Virginia Woolf

quote: Why are women... so much more interesting to men than men are to women?
author: Virginia Woolf

quote: For most of history, Anonymous was a woman.
author: Virginia Woolf

quote: Life is not a series of gig lamps symmetrically arranged; life is a luminous halo, a semi-transparent envelope surrounding us from the beginning of consciousness to the end.
author: Virginia Woolf

quote: The eyes of others our prisons; their thoughts our cages.
author: Virginia Woolf

quote: I can only note that the past is beautiful because one never realises an emotion at the time. It expands later, and thus we don't have complete emotions about the present, only about the past.
author: Virginia Woolf

quote: I thought how unpleasant it is to be locked out; and I thought how it is worse, perhaps, to be locked in.
author: Virginia Woolf

quote: Someone has to die in order that the rest of us should value life more.
author: Virginia Woolf

quote: The beauty of the world, which is so soon to perish, has two edges, one of laughter, one of anguish, cutting the heart asunder.
author: Virginia Woolf

quote: Women have served all these centuries as looking glasses possessing the power of reflecting the figure of man at twice its natural size.
author: Virginia Woolf

quote: Arrange whatever pieces come your way.
author: Virginia Woolf

quote: To enjoy freedom we have to control ourselves.
author: Virginia Woolf

quote: Mental fight means thinking against the current, not with it. It is our business to puncture gas bags and discover the seeds of truth.
author: Virginia Woolf

quote: Yet it is in our idleness, in our dreams, that the submerged truth sometimes comes to the top.
author: Virginia Woolf

quote: Nothing has really happened until it has been recorded.
author: Virginia Woolf

quote: As a woman I have no country. As a woman my country is the whole world.
author: Virginia Woolf

quote: Language is wine upon the lips.
author: Virginia Woolf

quote: These are the soul's changes. I don't believe in ageing. I believe in forever altering one's aspect to the sun. Hence my optimism.
author: Virginia Woolf

quote: Every secret of a writer's soul, every experience of his life, every quality of his mind is written large in his works.
author: Virginia Woolf

quote: Fiction is like a spider's web, attached ever so slightly perhaps, but still attached to life at all four corners. Often the attachment is scarcely perceptible.
author: Virginia Woolf

quote: I read the book of Job last night, I don't think God comes out well in it.
author: Virginia Woolf

quote: It is fatal to be a man or woman pure and simple: one must be a woman manly, or a man womanly.
author: Virginia Woolf

quote: Rigid, the skeleton of habit alone upholds the human frame.
author: Virginia Woolf

quote: It is far more difficult to murder a phantom than a reality.
author: Virginia Woolf

quote: Humor is the first of the gifts to perish in a foreign tongue.
author: Virginia Woolf

quote: Once conform, once do what other people do because they do it, and a lethargy steals over all the finer nerves and faculties of the soul. She becomes all outer show and inward emptiness; dull, callous, and indifferent.
author: Virginia Woolf

quote: The truth is, I often like women. I like their unconventionality. I like their completeness. I like their anonymity.
author: Virginia Woolf

quote: Really I don't like human nature unless all candied over with art.
author: Virginia Woolf

quote: The history of men's opposition to women's emancipation is more interesting perhaps than the story of that emancipation itself.
author: Virginia Woolf

quote: The older one grows, the more one likes indecency.
author: Virginia Woolf

quote: One of the signs of passing youth is the birth of a sense of fellowship with other human beings as we take our place among them.
author: Virginia Woolf

quote: The telephone, which interrupts the most serious conversations and cuts short the most weighty observations, has a romance of its own.
author: Virginia Woolf

quote: Literature is strewn with the wreckage of men who have minded beyond reason the opinions of others.
author: Virginia Woolf

quote: Boredom is the legitimate kingdom of the philanthropic.
author: Virginia Woolf

quote: It is far harder to kill a phantom than a reality.
author: Virginia Woolf

quote: There is much to support the view that it is clothes that wear us, and not we, them; we may make them take the mould of arm or breast, but they mould our hearts, our brains, our tongues to their liking.
author: Virginia Woolf

quote: On the outskirts of every agony sits some observant fellow who points.
author: Virginia Woolf

quote: It is in our idleness, in our dreams, that the submerged truth sometimes comes to the top.
author: Virginia Woolf

quote: If we help an educated man's daughter to go to Cambridge are we not forcing her to think not about education but about war? - not how she can learn, but how she can fight in order that she might win the same advantages as her brothers?
author: Virginia Woolf

quote: A woman must have money and a room of her own if she is to write fiction.
author: Virginia Woolf

quote: Let a man get up and say, Behold, this is the truth, and instantly I perceive a sandy cat filching a piece of fish in the background. Look, you have forgotten the cat, I say.
author: Virginia Woolf

quote: The poet gives us his essence, but prose takes the mold of the body and mind.
author: Virginia Woolf

quote: Odd how the creative power at once brings the whole universe to order.
author: Virginia Woolf

quote: One likes people much better when they're battered down by a prodigious siege of misfortune than when they triumph.
author: Virginia Woolf

quote: Who shall measure the hat and violence of the poet's heart when caught and tangled in a woman's body?
author: Virginia Woolf

quote: Each has his past shut in him like the leaves of a book known to him by his heart, and his friends can only read the title.
author: Virginia Woolf

quote: Yet, it is true, poetry is delicious; the best prose is that which is most full of poetry.
author: Virginia Woolf

quote: I want the concentration and the romance, and the worlds all glued together, fused, glowing: have no time to waste any more on prose.
author: Virginia Woolf

quote: Masterpieces are not single and solitary births; they are the outcome of many years of thinking in common, of thinking by the body of the people, so that the experience of the mass is behind the single voice.
author: Virginia Woolf

quote: This soul, or life within us, by no means agrees with the life outside us. If one has the courage to ask her what she thinks, she is always saying the very opposite to what other people say.
author: Virginia Woolf

quote: The man who is aware of himself is henceforward independent; and he is never bored, and life is only too short, and he is steeped through and through with a profound yet temperate happiness.
author: Virginia Woolf

quote: This is an important book, the critic assumes, because it deals with war. This is an insignificant book because it deals with the feelings of women in a drawing-room.
author: Virginia Woolf

quote: It's not catastrophes, murders, deaths, diseases, that age and kill us; it's the way people look and laugh, and run up the steps of omnibuses.
author: Virginia Woolf

quote: I would venture to guess that Anon, who wrote so many poems without signing them, was often a woman.
author: Virginia Woolf

quote: It seems as if an age of genius must be succeeded by an age of endeavour; riot and extravagance by cleanliness and hard work.
author: Virginia Woolf

quote: There can be no two opinions as to what a highbrow is. He is the man or woman of thoroughbred intelligence who rides his mind at a gallop across country in pursuit of an idea.
author: Virginia Woolf

quote: Give me four years to teach the children and the seed I have sown will never be uprooted.
author: Vladimir Lenin

quote: The goal of socialism is communism.
author: Vladimir Lenin

quote: The way to crush the bourgeoisie is to grind them between the millstones of taxation and inflation.
author: Vladimir Lenin

quote: A lie told often enough becomes the truth.
author: Vladimir Lenin

quote: Give us the child for 8 years and it will be a Bolshevik forever.
author: Vladimir Lenin

quote: One man with a gun can control 100 without one.
author: Vladimir Lenin

quote: There are no morals in politics; there is only expedience. A scoundrel may be of use to us just because he is a scoundrel.
author: Vladimir Lenin

quote: The oppressed are allowed once every few years to decide which particular representatives of the oppressing class are to represent and repress them in parliament.
author: Vladimir Lenin

quote: It is true that liberty is precious; so precious that it must be carefully rationed.
author: Vladimir Lenin

quote: The best way to destroy the capitalist system is to debauch the currency.
author: Vladimir Lenin

quote: The press should be not only a collective propagandist and a collective agitator, but also a collective organizer of the masses.
author: Vladimir Lenin

quote: Without revolutionary theory there can be no revolutionary movement.
author: Vladimir Lenin

quote: Democracy is indispensable to socialism.
author: Vladimir Lenin

quote: Sometimes - history needs a push.
author: Vladimir Lenin

quote: Every cook has to learn how to govern the state.
author: Vladimir Lenin

quote: Fascism is capitalism in decay.
author: Vladimir Lenin

quote: When there is state there can be no freedom, but when there is freedom there will be no state.
author: Vladimir Lenin

quote: A revolution is impossible without a revolutionary situation; furthermore, not every revolutionary situation leads to revolution.
author: Vladimir Lenin

quote: The most important thing when ill is to never lose heart.
author: Vladimir Lenin

quote: No amount of political freedom will satisfy the hungry masses.
author: Vladimir Lenin

quote: Crime is a product of social excess.
author: Vladimir Lenin

quote: Politics begin where the masses are, not where there are thousands, but where there are millions, that is where serious politics begin.
author: Vladimir Lenin

quote: Freedom in capitalist society always remains about the same as it was in ancient Greek republics: Freedom for slave owners.
author: Vladimir Lenin

quote: Can a nation be free if it oppresses other nations? It cannot.
author: Vladimir Lenin

quote: If it were necessary to give the briefest possible definition of imperialism, we should have to say that imperialism is the monopoly stage of capitalism.
author: Vladimir Lenin

quote: Communism is Soviet power plus the electrification of the whole country.
author: Vladimir Lenin

quote: Any cook should be able to run the country.
author: Vladimir Lenin

quote: Despair is typical of those who do not understand the causes of evil, see no way out, and are incapable of struggle. The modern industrial proletariat does not belong to the category of such classes.
author: Vladimir Lenin

quote: While the State exists there can be no freedom; when there is freedom there will be no State.
author: Vladimir Lenin

quote: Capitalists are no more capable of self-sacrifice than a man is capable of lifting himself up by his own bootstraps.
author: Vladimir Lenin

quote: Our program necessarily includes the propaganda of atheism.
author: Vladimir Lenin

quote: When one makes a Revolution, one cannot mark time; one must always go forward - or go back. He who now talks about the 'freedom of the press' goes backward, and halts our headlong course towards Socialism.
author: Vladimir Lenin

quote: The government is tottering. We must deal it the death blow an any cost. To delay action is the same as death.
author: Vladimir Lenin

quote: It is impossible to predict the time and progress of revolution. It is governed by its own more or less mysterious laws.
author: Vladimir Lenin

quote: If Socialism can only be realized when the intellectual development of all the people permits it, then we shall not see Socialism for at least five hundred years.
author: Vladimir Lenin

quote: Under socialism all will govern in turn and will soon become accustomed to no one governing.
author: Vladimir Lenin

quote: Without a revolutionary theory there cannot be a revolutionary movement.
author: Vladimir Lenin

quote: The history of all countries shows that the working class exclusively by its own effort is able to develop only trade-union consciousness.
author: Vladimir Lenin

quote: To rely upon conviction, devotion, and other excellent spiritual qualities; that is not to be taken seriously in politics.
author: Vladimir Lenin

quote: Those who can make you believe absurdities can make you commit atrocities.
author: Voltaire

quote: Common sense is not so common.
author: Voltaire

quote: It is difficult to free fools from the chains they revere.
author: Voltaire

quote: God gave us the gift of life; it is up to us to give ourselves the gift of living well.
author: Voltaire

quote: Every man is guilty of all the good he did not do.
author: Voltaire

quote: To the living we owe respect, but to the dead we owe only the truth.
author: Voltaire

quote: Judge a man by his questions rather than his answers.
author: Voltaire

quote: The art of medicine consists in amusing the patient while nature cures the disease.
author: Voltaire

quote: Appreciation is a wonderful thing: It makes what is excellent in others belong to us as well.
author: Voltaire

quote: It is dangerous to be right in matters on which the established authorities are wrong.
author: Voltaire

quote: No problem can withstand the assault of sustained thinking.
author: Voltaire

quote: If God did not exist, it would be necessary to invent Him.
author: Voltaire

quote: Faith consists in believing when it is beyond the power of reason to believe.
author: Voltaire

quote: The Holy Roman Empire is neither Holy, nor Roman, nor an Empire.
author: Voltaire

quote: It is better to risk saving a guilty man than to condemn an innocent one.
author: Voltaire

quote: It is lamentable, that to be a good patriot one must become the enemy of the rest of mankind.
author: Voltaire

quote: Doubt is not a pleasant condition, but certainty is absurd.
author: Voltaire

quote: Love is a canvas furnished by nature and embroidered by imagination.
author: Voltaire

quote: When it is a question of money, everybody is of the same religion.
author: Voltaire

quote: Life is thickly sown with thorns, and I know no other remedy than to pass quickly through them. The longer we dwell on our misfortunes, the greater is their power to harm us.
author: Voltaire

quote: I have never made but one prayer to God, a very short one: 'O Lord make my enemies ridiculous.' And God granted it.
author: Voltaire

quote: What is tolerance? It is the consequence of humanity. We are all formed of frailty and error; let us pardon reciprocally each other's folly - that is the first law of nature.
author: Voltaire

quote: Man is free at the moment he wishes to be.
author: Voltaire

quote: God is not on the side of the big battalions, but on the side of those who shoot best.
author: Voltaire

quote: All the reasonings of men are not worth one sentiment of women.
author: Voltaire

quote: Think for yourselves and let others enjoy the privilege to do so, too.
author: Voltaire

quote: It is forbidden to kill; therefore all murderers are punished unless they kill in large numbers and to the sound of trumpets.
author: Voltaire

quote: We must cultivate our own garden. When man was put in the garden of Eden he was put there so that he should work, which proves that man was not born to rest.
author: Voltaire

quote: Illusion is the first of all pleasures.
author: Voltaire

quote: Each player must accept the cards life deals him or her: but once they are in hand, he or she alone must decide how to play the cards in order to win the game.
author: Voltaire

quote: My life is a struggle.
author: Voltaire

quote: Optimism is the madness of insisting that all is well when we are miserable.
author: Voltaire

quote: Better is the enemy of good.
author: Voltaire

quote: The best government is a benevolent tyranny tempered by an occasional assassination.
author: Voltaire

quote: Tears are the silent language of grief.
author: Voltaire

quote: Superstition is to religion what astrology is to astronomy the mad daughter of a wise mother. These daughters have too long dominated the earth.
author: Voltaire

quote: A witty saying proves nothing.
author: Voltaire

quote: Perfection is attained by slow degrees; it requires the hand of time.
author: Voltaire

quote: Injustice in the end produces independence.
author: Voltaire

quote: Is there anyone so wise as to learn by the experience of others?
author: Voltaire

quote: Prejudices are what fools use for reason.
author: Voltaire

quote: History is only the register of crimes and misfortunes.
author: Voltaire

quote: The secret of being a bore... is to tell everything.
author: Voltaire

quote: Clever tyrants are never punished.
author: Voltaire

quote: Let us read and let us dance - two amusements that will never do any harm to the world.
author: Voltaire

quote: In general, the art of government consists of taking as much money as possible from one class of citizens to give to another.
author: Voltaire

quote: To hold a pen is to be at war.
author: Voltaire

quote: We are all full of weakness and errors; let us mutually pardon each other our follies - it is the first law of nature.
author: Voltaire

quote: It is not sufficient to see and to know the beauty of a work. We must feel and be affected by it.
author: Voltaire

quote: It is said that the present is pregnant with the future.
author: Voltaire

quote: The ear is the avenue to the heart.
author: Voltaire

quote: I am very fond of truth, but not at all of martyrdom.
author: Voltaire

quote: He was a great patriot, a humanitarian, a loyal friend; provided, of course, he really is dead.
author: Voltaire

quote: It is not enough to conquer; one must learn to seduce.
author: Voltaire

quote: Opinion has caused more trouble on this little earth than plagues or earthquakes.
author: Voltaire

quote: He must be very ignorant for he answers every question he is asked.
author: Voltaire

quote: Chance is a word void of sense; nothing can exist without a cause.
author: Voltaire

quote: We are rarely proud when we are alone.
author: Voltaire

quote: Use, do not abuse... neither abstinence nor excess ever renders man happy.
author: Voltaire

quote: The best is the enemy of the good.
author: Voltaire

quote: If you can dream it, you can do it.
author: Walt Disney

quote: All our dreams can come true, if we have the courage to pursue them.
author: Walt Disney

quote: We keep moving forward, opening new doors, and doing new things, because we're curious and curiosity keeps leading us down new paths.
author: Walt Disney

quote: The way to get started is to quit talking and begin doing.
author: Walt Disney

quote: You can design and create, and build the most wonderful place in the world. But it takes people to make the dream a reality.
author: Walt Disney

quote: It's kind of fun to do the impossible.
author: Walt Disney

quote: Of all of our inventions for mass communication, pictures still speak the most universally understood language.
author: Walt Disney

quote: I always like to look on the optimistic side of life, but I am realistic enough to know that life is a complex matter.
author: Walt Disney

quote: All the adversity I've had in my life, all my troubles and obstacles, have strengthened me... You may not realize it when it happens, but a kick in the teeth may be the best thing in the world for you.
author: Walt Disney

quote: The more you like yourself, the less you are like anyone else, which makes you unique.
author: Walt Disney

quote: Times and conditions change so rapidly that we must keep our aim constantly focused on the future.
author: Walt Disney

quote: When you believe in a thing, believe in it all the way, implicitly and unquestionable.
author: Walt Disney

quote: When you're curious, you find lots of interesting things to do.
author: Walt Disney

quote: Movies can and do have tremendous influence in shaping young lives in the realm of entertainment towards the ideals and objectives of normal adulthood.
author: Walt Disney

quote: I only hope that we don't lose sight of one thing - that it was all started by a mouse.
author: Walt Disney

quote: I would rather entertain and hope that people learned something than educate people and hope they were entertained.
author: Walt Disney

quote: You're dead if you aim only for kids. Adults are only kids grown up, anyway.
author: Walt Disney

quote: There is more treasure in books than in all the pirate's loot on Treasure Island.
author: Walt Disney

quote: Disneyland will never be completed. It will continue to grow as long as there is imagination left in the world.
author: Walt Disney

quote: I love Mickey Mouse more than any woman I have ever known.
author: Walt Disney

quote: You reach a point where you don't work for money.
author: Walt Disney

quote: I have been up against tough competition all my life. I wouldn't know how to get along without it.
author: Walt Disney

quote: Our heritage and ideals, our code and standards - the things we live by and teach our children - are preserved or diminished by how freely we exchange ideas and feelings.
author: Walt Disney

quote: A man should never neglect his family for business.
author: Walt Disney

quote: Disneyland is a work of love. We didn't go into Disneyland just with the idea of making money.
author: Walt Disney

quote: Animation can explain whatever the mind of man can conceive. This facility makes it the most versatile and explicit means of communication yet devised for quick mass appreciation.
author: Walt Disney

quote: We allow no geniuses around our Studio.
author: Walt Disney

quote: We believed in our idea - a family park where parents and children could have fun- together.
author: Walt Disney

quote: Of all the things I've done, the most vital is coordinating those who work with me and aiming their efforts at a certain goal.
author: Walt Disney

quote: Animation offers a medium of story telling and visual entertainment which can bring pleasure and information to people of all ages everywhere in the world.
author: Walt Disney

quote: Mickey Mouse popped out of my mind onto a drawing pad 20 years ago on a train ride from Manhattan to Hollywood at a time when business fortunes of my brother Roy and myself were at lowest ebb and disaster seemed right around the corner.
author: Walt Disney

quote: I believe in being an innovator.
author: Walt Disney

quote: I do not like to repeat successes, I like to go on to other things.
author: Walt Disney

quote: Laughter is America's most important export.
author: Walt Disney

quote: Crowded classrooms and half-day sessions are a tragic waste of our greatest national resource - the minds of our children.
author: Walt Disney

quote: There's nothing funnier than the human animal.
author: Walt Disney

quote: I don't like formal gardens. I like wild nature. It's just the wilderness instinct in me, I guess.
author: Walt Disney

quote: People still think of me as a cartoonist, but the only thing I lift a pen or pencil for these days is to sign a contract, a check, or an autograph.
author: Walt Disney

quote: All cartoon characters and fables must be exaggeration, caricatures. It is the very nature of fantasy and fable.
author: Walt Disney

quote: I'd say it's been my biggest problem all my life... it's money. It takes a lot of money to make these dreams come true.
author: Walt Disney

quote: Mickey Mouse is, to me, a symbol of independence. He was a means to an end.
author: Walt Disney

quote: When people laugh at Mickey Mouse, it's because he's so human; and that is the secret of his popularity.
author: Walt Disney

quote: Animation is different from other parts. Its language is the language of caricature. Our most difficult job was to develop the cartoon's unnatural but seemingly natural anatomy for humans and animals.
author: Walt Disney

quote: We have created characters and animated them in the dimension of depth, revealing through them to our perturbed world that the things we have in common far outnumber and outweigh those that divide us.
author: Walt Disney

quote: You can't just let nature run wild.
author: Walt Disney

quote: I never called my work an 'art'. It's part of show business, the business of building entertainment.
author: Walt Disney

quote: We are not trying to entertain the critics. I'll take my chances with the public.
author: Walt Disney

quote: Disneyland is a show.
author: Walt Disney

quote: I have no use for people who throw their weight around as celebrities, or for those who fawn over you just because you are famous.
author: Walt Disney

quote: Whenever I go on a ride, I'm always thinking of what's wrong with the thing and how it can be improved.
author: Walt Disney

quote: We did it Disneyland, in the knowledge that most of the people I talked to thought it would be a financial disaster - closed and forgotten within the first year.
author: Walt Disney

quote: I am not influenced by the techniques or fashions of any other motion picture company.
author: Walt Disney

quote: Disneyland is the star, everything else is in the supporting role.
author: Walt Disney

quote: I try to build a full personality for each of our cartoon characters - to make them personalities.
author: Walt Disney

quote: I started, actually, to make my first animated cartoon in 1920. Of course, they were very crude things then and I used sort of little puppet things.
author: Walt Disney

quote: It's no secret that we were sticking just about every nickel we had on the chance that people would really be interested in something totally new and unique in the field of entertainment.
author: Walt Disney

quote: Keep your face always toward the sunshine - and shadows will fall behind you.
author: Walt Whitman

quote: Be curious, not judgmental.
author: Walt Whitman

quote: Other lands have their vitality in a few, a class, but we have it in the bulk of our people.
author: Walt Whitman

quote: Do I contradict myself? Very well, then I contradict myself, I am large, I contain multitudes.
author: Walt Whitman

quote: I am as bad as the worst, but, thank God, I am as good as the best.
author: Walt Whitman

quote: I have learned that to be with those I like is enough.
author: Walt Whitman

quote: Re-examine all that you have been told... dismiss that which insults your soul.
author: Walt Whitman

quote: Let your soul stand cool and composed before a million universes.
author: Walt Whitman

quote: I exist as I am, that is enough.
author: Walt Whitman

quote: Oh while I live, to be the ruler of life, not a slave, to meet life as a powerful conqueror, and nothing exterior to me will ever take command of me.
author: Walt Whitman

quote: To me, every hour of the day and night is an unspeakably perfect miracle.
author: Walt Whitman

quote: Whatever satisfies the soul is truth.
author: Walt Whitman

quote: The art of art, the glory of expression and the sunshine of the light of letters, is simplicity.
author: Walt Whitman

quote: I no doubt deserved my enemies, but I don't believe I deserved my friends.
author: Walt Whitman

quote: Simplicity is the glory of expression.
author: Walt Whitman

quote: I believe a leaf of grass is no less than the journey-work of the stars.
author: Walt Whitman

quote: Every moment of light and dark is a miracle.
author: Walt Whitman

quote: Stranger, if you passing meet me and desire to speak to me, why should you not speak to me? And why should I not speak to you?
author: Walt Whitman

quote: When I give I give myself.
author: Walt Whitman

quote: We convince by our presence.
author: Walt Whitman

quote: To die is different from what any one supposed, and luckier.
author: Walt Whitman

quote: A morning-glory at my window satisfies me more than the metaphysics of books.
author: Walt Whitman

quote: Give me odorous at sunrise a garden of beautiful flowers where I can walk undisturbed.
author: Walt Whitman

quote: After you have exhausted what there is in business, politics, conviviality, and so on - have found that none of these finally satisfy, or permanently wear - what remains? Nature remains.
author: Walt Whitman

quote: Henceforth I ask not good fortune. I myself am good fortune.
author: Walt Whitman

quote: Freedom - to walk free and own no superior.
author: Walt Whitman

quote: Have you learned the lessons only of those who admired you, and were tender with you, and stood aside for you? Have you not learned great lessons from those who braced themselves against you, and disputed passage with you?
author: Walt Whitman

quote: The future is no more uncertain than the present.
author: Walt Whitman

quote: I celebrate myself, and sing myself.
author: Walt Whitman

quote: To have great poets, there must be great audiences.
author: Walt Whitman

quote: There is no week nor day nor hour when tyranny may not enter upon this country, if the people lose their roughness and spirit of defiance.
author: Walt Whitman

quote: Viewed freely, the English language is the accretion and growth of every dialect, race, and range of time, and is both the free and compacted composition of all.
author: Walt Whitman

quote: And your very flesh shall be a great poem.
author: Walt Whitman

quote: The genius of the United States is not best or most in its executives or legislatures, nor in its ambassadors or authors or colleges, or churches, or parlors, nor even in its newspapers or inventors, but always most in the common people.
author: Walt Whitman

quote: Nothing endures but personal qualities.
author: Walt Whitman

quote: Behold I do not give lectures or a little charity, When I give I give myself.
author: Walt Whitman

quote: In the confusion we stay with each other, happy to be together, speaking without uttering a single word.
author: Walt Whitman

quote: And I will show that nothing can happen more beautiful than death.
author: Walt Whitman

quote: The whole theory of the universe is directed unerringly to one single individual.
author: Walt Whitman

quote: I accept reality and dare not question it.
author: Walt Whitman

quote: Have you heard that it was good to gain the day? I also say it is good to fall, battles are lost in the same spirit in which they are won.
author: Walt Whitman

quote: Now I see the secret of making the best person: it is to grow in the open air and to eat and sleep with the earth.
author: Walt Whitman

quote: The beautiful uncut hair of graves.
author: Walt Whitman

quote: Nothing can happen more beautiful than death.
author: Walt Whitman

quote: I say that democracy can never prove itself beyond cavil, until it founds and luxuriantly grows its own forms of art, poems, schools, theology, displacing all that exists, or that has been produced anywhere in the past, under opposite influences.
author: Walt Whitman

quote: I cannot be awake for nothing looks to me as it did before, Or else I am awake for the first time, and all before has been a mean sleep.
author: Walt Whitman

quote: All faults may be forgiven of him who has perfect candor.
author: Walt Whitman

quote: And whoever walks a furlong without sympathy walks to his own funeral drest in his shroud.
author: Walt Whitman

quote: I say to mankind, Be not curious about God. For I, who am curious about each, am not curious about God - I hear and behold God in every object, yet understand God not in the least.
author: Walt Whitman

quote: The beauty of independence, departure, actions that rely on themselves.
author: Walt Whitman

quote: Why are there trees I never walk under but large and melodious thoughts descend upon me?
author: Walt Whitman

quote: The proof of a poet is that his country absorbs him as affectionately as he has absorbed it.
author: Walt Whitman

quote: He most honors my style who learns under it to destroy the teacher.
author: Walt Whitman

quote: The great city is that which has the greatest man or woman: if it be a few ragged huts, it is still the greatest city in the whole world.
author: Walt Whitman

quote: The shallow consider liberty a release from all law, from every constraint. The wise man sees in it, on the contrary, the potent Law of Laws.
author: Walt Whitman

quote: The words of my book nothing, the drift of it everything.
author: Walt Whitman

quote: If any thing is sacred, the human body is sacred.
author: Walt Whitman

quote: Judging from the main portions of the history of the world, so far, justice is always in jeopardy.
author: Walt Whitman

quote: A great city is that which has the greatest men and women.
author: Walt Whitman

quote: There is that indescribable freshness and unconsciousness about an illiterate person that humbles and mocks the power of the noblest expressive genius.
author: Walt Whitman

quote: Only when the tide goes out do you discover who's been swimming naked.
author: Warren Buffett

quote: It takes 20 years to build a reputation and five minutes to ruin it. If you think about that, you'll do things differently.
author: Warren Buffett

quote: Someone is sitting in the shade today because someone planted a tree a long time ago.
author: Warren Buffett

quote: Risk comes from not knowing what you're doing.

quote: Rule No.1: Never lose money. Rule No.2: Never forget rule No.1.
author: Warren Buffett

quote: Price is what you pay. Value is what you get.

quote: Chains of habit are too light to be felt until they are too heavy to be broken.
author: Warren Buffett

quote: It's far better to buy a wonderful company at a fair price than a fair company at a wonderful price.

quote: I always knew I was going to be rich. I don't think I ever doubted it for a minute.
author: Warren Buffett

quote: When a management with a reputation for brilliance tackles a business with a reputation for bad economics, it is the reputation of the business that remains intact.
